Lurking to seize grain and wealth, harboring secret intent to plunder;
coveting rank and office, inwardly nurturing treacherous designs.
Flattering the rich and powerful, oppressing the lowly and humble.
Promoting the crooked while suppressing the upright,
concealing what is right while scrutinizing what is wrong.
Shifting blame and claiming credit,
shedding guilt and selling malice.
From past deeds to the present life,
one has amassed resentment and slander,
unexpectedly incurring misfortune and turmoil.
Upon death, one falls into hell,
suffering endless torment for kalpas.
When the suffering ends, one is reborn,
only to enter the evil destinies.
When the retribution is exhausted, one returns,
born again into this world.
Yet the residual effects of past karma remain,
and the cycle of retribution continues unabated.

Now, having heard the sutra’s teachings,
one is struck with terror and alarm.
Respectfully before the sacred presence,
we humbly offer repentance.
Let each person reverently bow in devotion,
with sincere hearts, we pay homage.

With sincere hearts, we pay homage to the Most Venerable of the Supreme Ultimate Teaching.

The homage to the Heavenly Worthies and Sacred Ones now complete,
we once more devote our whole hearts,
gazing afar toward the divine abodes.
We take refuge in the Purple Sovereign’s Palace of Heavenly Unity and True Felicity,
the Court of Primordial Harmony and Transmigration,
and the Northern Culmen’s Hall of Protective Sagacity,
along with all the perfected immortals.

Today, the assembly of this ritual site
reverently invokes the Teaching Master,
the Northern Culmen’s Heavenly Guardian of Sagely Assistance and Compliance,
the True Martial and Efficacious Lord of Blessing and Virtue,
the Jade Void Preceptor, the Mysterious Heavenly Thearch.
May radiance suffuse the cinnabar towers,
auspicious responses fill the azure heavens,
illuminating the mortal realm,
and abundantly bestowing grace and favor.

Now, on behalf of [Name],
we seek repentance for the transgressions of the First Precept:
secret plotting with malice, harming others to benefit oneself.
From past lives to the present,
the residual calamities of former kalpas,
extending upward to ancestors,
and downward to descendants.
Some have recklessly harmed living beings,
others have wielded power to slay creatures.
Some have acted contrary to right principle,
flattering and employing deceitful schemes.
Some have envied the worthy and resented the capable,
diminishing others to benefit themselves.
Outwardly appearing amiable and admirable,
inwardly harboring perversity and malice.
Sending them to manage granaries, only to set traps;
pushing them into wells, then casting stones.
Bullying the orphaned and widowed,
cruelly oppressing the meek and mediocre.
Smiling while concealing daggers,
shooting hidden arrows from the eyes.
Sins are enumerated,
evils have filled the measure,
disrupting the spirit officials,
who ceaselessly record the transgressions.

Now, relying on the power of repentance,
we pray for forgiveness and absolution.
We look upward to the perfected ones,
entreating them to proclaim grace upon the world,
and command the Court of Primordial Harmony and Transmigration,
the Northern Culmen’s Hall of Protective Sagacity,
and the Nine Palaces of the Three Origins,
along with all the celestial bureaus and offices.
May the celestial officials, immortal officers,
spirit officials, and true lords,
the assisting and patrolling attendants,
widely extend their compassion,
and grant absolution.

The repenting disciple [Name] and the assembly of fellow practitioners,
abiding by the mysterious statutes,
entering the Dao and attaining the true precepts,
shall practice non-action,
and diligently cultivate the Way.
We vow that from this day forward,
we shall uphold loyalty and integrity,
retreat to humility and reverence,
cherish all beings and pity all life,
regarding others as ourselves.
With empty minds and sincere hearts,
dare we harbor the thoughts of wolves glancing back?
Holding our breath and concentrating our spirit,
shall we emulate the sparrow’s gratitude in offering?
Having thus confessed,
we now present this repentance.

We humbly pray that the celestial officials inscribe our names in the register of destiny,
and the earthly scribes erase our transgressions from the ledger.
May our bodies be at peace and our lives secure,
our aspirations fulfilled and our spirits clear.
May the seven generations of ancestral souls
eternally attain blessed fruits;
may the obstacles and afflictions of three lifetimes
be entirely eradicated.
May we always serve the true and orthodox,
forever follow the mysterious teaching.
Through these benefits,
may all be adorned with splendor,
the sacred peaks rise ever higher,
and the imperial domain stand firm forever.
May the myriad peoples turn their robes in admiration,
and the hundred barbarians come bearing caps and sashes.
May our longevity rival the Southern Mountains,
and all look up to the one who brings prosperity.

chunks.original_text: 星朝北极，鼎臻四海以无虞。 一切有情，俱登道岸。 北极真武普慈度世法忏卷之一竟 北极真武普慈度世法忏卷之二 步虚 尔时，妙行真人告诸仙曰：谨按洞真本行经云，玉帝者，乃元炁之祖，造化之根。 静而圣，即元始天尊； 动而神，即玉皇上帝。 居玉清宫通明殿，统御万天，化育群品。 万汇之主，造化之原。 在天为众圣之尊，在世为万教之主。 而老君者，道之应形，名号无边，洞真极圣，本无常形，消则为气，息则为人。 或於太虚之中，凝为真容，体大无边，相好备足，上无所攀，下无所蹑。 或在云华之上，身如金色，高真侍卫，百灵宗奉。 或坐莲花之内，建七曜玲珑之冠，披九色离罗之帔，项负圆光，照耀天地，处宝台金殿、珠玉帷帐。 万帝朝礼，神兵卫轩。 或金容玉姿，黄裳绣帔。 或素服玄冠，乘朱鬃白马。 或下治十天，封掌兆民，居紫微勾陈房，为天皇大帝。 或春夏秋冬，变化无量，此则返金阙之炁，更受炼飞玄通神之精也，故化身为真武。 其神通自在，随感则现，能白能黑，能方能圆，能屈能伸，能修能短，能老能少，能一能万。 纵横反覆，厥体靡常，亘古穷今，历代演教，接引九界，济度无边。 臣等历世多缘，幸亲至教，详明经典，与善因缘，钦奉上真，知归有自。 一心发念，皈依敬礼。 志心朝礼，虚无自然元始天尊。 志心朝礼，玉宸道君灵宝天尊。 志心朝礼，太上老君道德天尊。 志心朝礼，玉虚师相玄天上帝。 志心朝礼，圣父明真大帝。 志心朝礼，圣母琼真上仙。 志心朝礼，圣师丰乾大帝。 志心朝礼，西国紫玄元君。 志心朝礼，金阙化身天尊。 志心朝礼，玄元显应天尊。 志心朝礼，太清灵变天尊。 志心朝礼，高上玉真天尊。 志心朝礼，日光开瑞天尊。 志心朝礼，武曲应化天尊。 志心朝礼，虚星应化天尊。 志心朝礼，危星应化天尊。 志心朝礼，天一应化天尊。 志心朝礼，太一应化天尊。 志心朝礼，辰星应化天尊。 臣等志心皈身，皈神皈命，玄帝显灵应化诸尊上圣。 臣恭承太上垂训曰：夫人生天地之间，善恶不同，各自先身业缘所致。 修善善至，修福福来。 如影随形，似声应响。 悟则见道，迷则居尘。 有如宝珠，照鉴随物； 又如明镜，黑白自彰。 若修十善，克感天神，扶护世族，克昌后世，衣食自然，无穷寿量。 若修十恶，凶神降附，苦病切身，轮转受生，应诸恶报。 谨按修真第二戒云：不得杀害含生，以充滋味。 切虑弟子某一真乖本，百念俱非，求适口之肥鲜； 称快心之爽美。 捕猎投林之兽，搜逻飞野之禽。 挟弓驰射於山间，设网低沉於水底。 托合药祀神之故，及佞官媚贵之为。 煮宰、烹炮、燖煿、炙烙，岂念轮回於恶道，安知人物之一途。 或眷属以业报而改形。 或姻亲以罪缘而受果。 反餐其肉，欲润尔身。 不复识知，未能伤愍。 杀害愈甚，举动成愆。 上来诸业，见在世中。 疾体缠绵，寿命夭促，死堕地狱，长劫受苦。 苦尽复生，遂入恶道。 报尽复还，生於兹世。 以前业报，尚有余殃，受报未已。 今则闻经所说，探可忧惶。 仰对圣前，恭投忏悔。 皈命一心，虔诚信礼。 志心朝礼，上通无始天尊。 志心朝礼，上极无穷天尊。 志心朝礼，上及无间天尊。 志心朝礼，上象宗无天尊。
chunks.translated_text:
The stars pay homage to the North Star,
the tripod brings the Four Seas to peace without peril.
May all sentient beings together ascend the Dao’s shore.

*End of the First Scroll of the Northern Dipper True Martial Universal Compassion Salvation Dharma Repentance*
*Beginning of the Second Scroll of the Northern Dipper True Martial Universal Compassion Salvation Dharma Repentance*

**Pacing the Void**

At that time, the Wondrous Practice Perfected One addressed the assembled immortals, saying: According to the *Scripture of the Original Conduct of the Cavernous Truth*, the Jade Emperor is the progenitor of primordial qi and the root of creation.
In stillness, he is sagely—this is the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning;
in movement, he is numinous—this is the Jade Sovereign of the August Heaven.
Dwelling in the Jade Clarity Palace’s Hall of Luminous Communication, he governs the myriad heavens and nurtures all beings.
Lord of the ten thousand transformations, source of creation.
In heaven, he is the supreme among all sages;
in the world, he is the master of all teachings.

As for the Venerable Lord Lao, he is the incarnate form of the Dao, his names and titles boundless.
Utterly true, supremely sagely, fundamentally formless—
when dissolving, he becomes qi; when resting, he becomes human.
At times, within the Great Void, he condenses into his true countenance,
his body vast beyond measure, his marks of excellence complete,
with nothing above to grasp and nothing below to tread.
At times, upon the Cloud Blossom, his body gleams like gold,
attended by lofty immortals, revered by the hundred spirits.
At times, seated within a lotus, he wears a crown of the Seven Luminaries’ intricate radiance,
draped in a mantle of nine-hued parted silk,
a halo encircling his neck, illuminating heaven and earth,
abiding in a jeweled terrace and golden hall, within curtains of pearls and jade.
The myriad emperors pay homage, divine soldiers guard his chariot.

At times, his golden visage and jade form are clad in yellow robes and embroidered mantles.
At times, he dons plain garments and a dark cap, riding a crimson-maned white horse.
At times, he descends to govern the Ten Heavens, sealing and overseeing the myriad people,
dwelling in the Purple Tenuity’s Hook and Chen Chambers as the Heavenly August Emperor.
At times, through the seasons of spring, summer, autumn, and winter, his transformations are boundless—
this is the qi of the Golden Gate returning, refined anew to receive the essence of soaring, mysterious, and spiritually penetrating flight.
Thus, he manifests as True Martial.

His spiritual penetrations are free and unhindered, appearing in response to karmic conditions.
He can be white or black, square or round,
able to bend or stretch, lengthen or shorten,
age or rejuvenate, be one or become ten thousand.
In all directions and reversals, his form knows no constancy.
From ancient times to the present, through successive dynasties, he expounds the teachings,
guiding the nine realms and delivering boundless beings.

We, your servants, have accumulated many karmic conditions across lifetimes,
and are fortunate to have personally encountered this teaching.
Having studied the scriptures in detail and formed good karmic affinities,
we revere the Supreme Perfected and know the source of our return.
With wholehearted devotion, we take refuge and pay reverence.

With sincere hearts, we bow to the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning, the Self-So of the Void.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Numinous Treasure Celestial Worthy, the Dao Lord of the Jade Clarity.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Celestial Worthy of the Dao and Its Virtue, the Venerable Lord Lao.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the August Heavenly Sovereign of the Mysterious Heaven, the Jade Void Preceptor.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Sacred Father, the Radiant Perfected Emperor.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Sacred Mother, the Jade Perfected Immortal.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Sacred Preceptor, the Abundant Heavenly Emperor.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Purple Profundity Primordial Lady of the Western Realm.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Golden Gate’s Manifestation.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Mysterious Origin’s Manifest Response.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Grand Clarity’s Numinous Transformation.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Lofty Jade Perfection.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Sun’s Auspicious Radiance.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Martial Star’s Responsive Manifestation.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Void Star’s Responsive Manifestation.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Perilous Star’s Responsive Manifestation.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Celestial One’s Responsive Manifestation.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Grand One’s Responsive Manifestation.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Chronographic Star’s Responsive Manifestation.

With sincere hearts, we take refuge in body, take refuge in spirit, take refuge in life,
to the manifest and responsive numinous Perfected Ones and Supreme Sages of the Dark Emperor.

Your servants reverently receive the teachings bequeathed by the Supreme:
"All who are born between heaven and earth differ in good and evil,
each according to the karmic conditions of their former lives.
Cultivate goodness, and goodness will arrive; cultivate blessings, and blessings will come.
As a shadow follows form, as an echo responds to sound.
Awakened, one perceives the Dao; deluded, one dwells in the dust.
Like a precious pearl, it illuminates whatever it reflects;
like a bright mirror, black and white are naturally revealed.
If one cultivates the Ten Good Deeds, one will move the heavenly spirits,
who will protect and uphold one’s family, ensuring prosperity for future generations,
with clothing and food naturally abundant and longevity without limit.
If one cultivates the Ten Evils, malevolent spirits will descend and attach themselves,
bringing suffering and illness to the body, causing one to revolve through rebirths,
receiving all manner of evil retributions."

According to the *Second Precept of Cultivating the Truth*: "One must not kill living beings to sate one’s appetite."
Yet we, your disciples, have strayed from our original true nature, our hundred thoughts all misguided,
seeking the richness of flavors to please the palate,
pursuing the delight of the heart’s satisfaction.
We hunt beasts that flee into the forests, search out birds that fly in the wilds.
We ride with bows, shooting through the mountains; we cast nets, sinking them into the depths of waters.
We do so under the pretext of offering medicines to the spirits,
or to flatter officials and curry favor with the powerful.
Boiling, butchering, roasting, frying, simmering, grilling—
how could we consider the revolutions through evil destinies?
How could we know that humans and other beings share a single path?
Some may be our kin, transformed by karmic retribution;
others may be our relatives, receiving the fruits of their sins.
We consume their flesh, desiring to nourish our own bodies,
yet fail to recognize them, unable to feel compassion for their suffering.
The more we kill, the more our actions become transgressions.
All these karmic deeds manifest in the present life:
our bodies are wracked with illness, our lifespans cut short.
Upon death, we fall into hell, suffering for kalpas without end.
When our suffering is exhausted, we are reborn, entering evil destinies.
When our retribution is complete, we return to this world,
yet the residual misfortunes of past karmic retribution remain,
and the cycle of suffering continues unabated.

Now, having heard the scriptures’ teachings, we probe our hearts in trepidation.
Before the sacred presence, we humbly offer our repentance.
With wholehearted devotion, we take refuge and pay reverence.

With sincere hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Unoriginated.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Unbounded.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Uninterrupted.
With sincere hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Symbolic Origin.

chunks.original_text: 今凭忏力愿，赐宽原显，望上真宣恩，勑下所部考官、考吏、考兵、考士，一切玄司，曹桉主者，广行慈悯，愿赐赦原。 求忏弟子某并法众等，遵奉玄科，入道登真戒，当行阴德，广济群生，誓从今去，心怀慈惠，志务善修。 剖析藩篱，解除罗网。 痛怜众命，常存救援之思； 爱同一身，不恣杀伤之欲。 即斯发露，径此忏陈。 伏愿金书锡赞卫之休，玉简赐安宁之庆。 削故杀误伤之罪，拔积冤理对之仇。 变化人身，脱离业障。 偿报之愆，尽涤； 显幽之际，俱安。 常奉至真，永依玄教。 以斯利益，遍悉庄严。 上愿宝鼎尊隆，金枝蕃衍。 公侯效勤而尽瘁； 官僚秉节以输忠。 任以无私论道，经邦而无异； 施於有政安民，济众之有余。 一切有情，同登道岸。 北极真武普急度世法忏卷之二竟 北极真武普慈度世法忏卷之三 步虚 尔时，妙行真人告诸仙曰：夫三宝大有金书，一炁分形三清，出号太初、溟涬、玄极。 洪蒙中有虚皇分置五劫：曰龙汉，曰赤明，曰上皇，曰延康，曰开皇。 当斯时也，天光未分，清浊未判，则知三老各布始炁，化生四灵，以定四隅，周环六合，日月运乎其中，推成万物明知。 玄武乃天一之炁，五灵老君太阴天一之化。 混沌赤文载，惟玄帝乃元始化身，太极别体。 上三皇时，下降为太始真人； 中三皇时，下降为太初真人； 下三皇时，下降为太素真人。 至黄帝时，下降正上天。 开皇劫初下世，紫云元年，岁当甲辰，三月戊辰三日甲寅庚午时，符太阳之精，托胎化生净乐国善胜皇后之腹，孕秀一十四月，即太上八十二化也。 净乐国，乃奎娄星之下海外仙国，上应龙变梵度天，玄帝产母左胁。 当生之时，异香瑞云，地皆金色。 七岁俯察仰观，靡所不通，潜心念道，志契太虚，愿事上天，溥福兆民。 十五岁辞父母，受紫玄君无极上道，越东海，历翼轸星，下於武当山修道四十二年，功成果满，白日上升。 玉帝封为玄武。 五百岁后，摄坎离真精，归根复命，上为三境辅臣，下作十天大圣，方得显名亿劫，与天地日月齐并。 是其果满矣。 臣等知因识果，感德蒙恩，先地先天，劫终劫始，长劳造化，仰俟裁成，敢效藿倾葵，专勤崇向，一心发念，稽首高真，志心敬礼。 志心朝礼，虚无自然元始天尊。 志心朝礼，玉宸道君灵宝天尊。 志心朝礼，太上老君道德天尊。 志心朝礼，玉虚师相玄天上帝。 志心朝礼，圣父明真大帝。 志心朝礼，圣母琼真上仙。 志心朝礼，圣师丰乾大帝。 志心朝礼，西国紫玄元君。 志心朝礼，金阙化身天尊。 志心朝礼，玄元显应天尊。 志心朝礼，太清灵变天尊。 志心朝礼，高上玉真天尊。 志心朝礼，日光开瑞天尊。 志心朝礼，武曲应化天尊。 志心朝礼，虚星应化天尊。 志心朝礼，危星应化天尊。 志心朝礼，天一应化天尊。 志心朝礼，太一应化天尊。 志心朝礼，辰星应化天尊。 臣等志心皈身，皈神皈命，玄天显灵应化，诸尊上圣。 臣闻太上垂训曰：凡世众生，自从有命，善心因被外色侵凌，耽诸爱欲。 遂乃障蔽善事，积习恶缘。 若能摄动归闲，存心内觉。 悟空非色，色想即空。 不作淫欲之愆，悟我六炁之道。 当常检身心，每虞过失，见诸经戒，常怀畏慎，毋入魔界，自坠恶道。

Now, by the power of this repentance, we humbly beseech that forgiveness be granted and mercy be made manifest. May the Supreme Perfections proclaim grace, commanding all under their jurisdiction—examiners of officials, examiners of clerks, examiners of soldiers, examiners of scholars, and all celestial bureaus, record-keepers, and masters of the registers—to widely extend compassion and bestow absolution.

The repentant disciple, along with the assembly of the Dharma, vow to uphold the mysterious statutes, enter the Dao, ascend to perfection through the precepts, practice hidden virtue, and broadly deliver all beings. From this day forward, we swear to harbor kindness and benevolence, devoting ourselves to the cultivation of goodness. We shall dismantle the fences and dissolve the nets, grieving for the lives of all beings, ever holding thoughts of rescue; loving them as our own bodies, never indulging the desire to kill or harm.

Having thus confessed and repented, we now prostrate ourselves, praying that golden scriptures bestow the blessing of protection, and jade tablets grant the joy of peace. May the sins of intentional and accidental killing be erased, and the accumulated enmities of karmic retribution be uprooted. May our human forms be transformed, freed from karmic obstructions. May all transgressions of requital be thoroughly cleansed, and both the manifest and hidden realms be at peace. May we forever serve the Supreme Perfection and eternally follow the mysterious teachings. Through these benefits, may all be adorned with splendor.

Above, we pray for the exaltation of the sacred tripod and the flourishing of the golden lineage. May lords and ministers exert themselves to the utmost in service; may officials uphold integrity and offer loyalty. Entrusted with impartial governance, may they discourse on the Dao and govern the state without deviation; in administering policies, may they bring peace to the people and abundance to the multitudes. May all sentient beings together ascend the shore of the Dao.

*End of the Second Scroll of the Northern Dipper True Martial’s Universal Salvation Dharma Repentance*
*Beginning of the Third Scroll of the Northern Dipper True Martial’s Universal Compassion Salvation Dharma Repentance*

**Pacing the Void**
At that time, the Perfected One of Wondrous Conduct addressed the assembled immortals: "The Three Treasures possess great golden scriptures, and the primordial qi divides into the Three Pure Ones, issuing forth as the titles *Tai Chu*, *Ming Xing*, and *Xuan Ji*. In the vast chaos, the Celestial August One established the Five Kalpas: *Long Han*, *Chi Ming*, *Shang Huang*, *Yan Kang*, and *Kai Huang*. At that time, the light of heaven was undivided, and the clear and turbid were not yet separated. Thus, the Three Elders each distributed the primordial qi, transforming and giving birth to the Four Spirits to stabilize the four directions, encompassing the six harmonies. The sun and moon moved within them, evolving and completing the myriad things.

Xuan Wu is the qi of Heavenly One, the transformation of the Five Spirits, the Elder Lord, and the Yin of Heavenly One. As recorded in the *Hun Dun Chi Wen*, the Dark Emperor is the transformed body of the Primordial Beginning, a separate embodiment of the Great Ultimate. During the era of the Upper Three Sovereigns, he descended as the Perfected One of the Great Beginning; in the Middle Three Sovereigns, as the Perfected One of the Great Origin; and in the Lower Three Sovereigns, as the Perfected One of the Great Simplicity. By the time of the Yellow Emperor, he descended to the Supreme Heaven. At the beginning of the *Kai Huang* kalpa, he descended into the world. In the first year of the *Purple Cloud* era, corresponding to the *jia-chen* year, on the third day of the third month—the *wu-chen* day, *jia-yin* hour, and *geng-wu* time—he embodied the essence of the Great Yang, entering the womb of Queen *Shan Sheng* of the *Jing Le* Kingdom. After fourteen months of gestation, he was born as the eighty-second transformation of the Most High.

The *Jing Le* Kingdom, a land of immortals beyond the sea beneath the *Kui* and *Lou* stars, corresponds above to the *Long Bian Fan Du* Heaven. The Dark Emperor emerged from his mother’s left side. At the moment of his birth, rare fragrances and auspicious clouds filled the air, and the earth turned golden. At seven, he observed all things with profound insight, his mind set on the Dao, his aspirations aligned with the Great Void. He vowed to serve the heavens and universally bless the people. At fifteen, he bid farewell to his parents, received the *Wuji Supreme Dao* from the Purple Mystery Lord, crossed the Eastern Sea, traversed the *Yi* and *Zhen* constellations, and descended to Mount Wudang, where he cultivated the Dao for forty-two years. Upon achieving perfection, he ascended to heaven in broad daylight. The Jade Emperor enfeoffed him as Xuan Wu. Five hundred years later, he gathered the true essences of *Kan* and *Li*, returning to the root and restoring the mandate. Above, he became a minister of the Three Realms; below, he became one of the Ten Heavenly Great Saints. Thus, his name was gloriously proclaimed for countless kalpas, equal in duration to heaven, earth, sun, and moon. Such was the fulfillment of his fruition.

We, your servants, knowing cause and recognizing effect, are moved by virtue and covered by grace. From the beginning of time and before heaven, from the end of one kalpa to the start of another, we have long labored under creation, awaiting your shaping and completion. We dare to offer the devotion of the bean to the sun, wholeheartedly revering and aspiring, with single-minded devotion, to bow in homage to the exalted Perfected Ones. With devoted hearts, we pay homage:

We reverently bow to the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void and the Natural.
We reverently bow to the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Jade Clarity Dao Lord.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Dao and Its Virtue, the Most High Lord Lao.
We reverently bow to the Jade Void Preceptor and Minister, the Dark Heavenly Emperor.
We reverently bow to the Sacred Father, the Radiant Perfected Great Emperor.
We reverently bow to the Sacred Mother, the Jade Perfected Immortal.
We reverently bow to the Sacred Preceptor, the Abundant Heavenly Emperor.
We reverently bow to the Purple Mystery Primordial Lady of the Western Land.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Golden Palace’s Transformed Body.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Manifest Response of the Primordial.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Numinous Transformation of the Great Clarity.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Highest Jade Perfection.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Sun’s Auspicious Light.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Martial Star’s Response and Transformation.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Void Star’s Response and Transformation.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Danger Star’s Response and Transformation.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Heavenly One’s Response and Transformation.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Great One’s Response and Transformation.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Morning Star’s Response and Transformation.

We, your servants, with devoted hearts, take refuge in the body, take refuge in the spirit, take refuge in the life of the Dark Heaven’s manifest numinous transformations and all the exalted sages.

We have heard the Most High’s teachings: 'All worldly beings, from the moment they receive life, have their good hearts assailed by external forms and overwhelmed by love and desire. Thus, they obscure good deeds and accumulate evil affinities. If one can withdraw from activity and return to tranquility, preserving inner awareness, realizing that emptiness is not form and that the thought of form is emptiness, one will not commit the transgressions of lust and desire, but awaken to the Dao of the six qi. One should constantly examine body and mind, ever wary of faults. Upon encountering the scriptures and precepts, one should always hold reverence and caution, never entering the demonic realm or falling into evil paths.'"

chunks.original_text: 谨按修真第三戒云：不得淫邪败真，秽慢灵气。 以今弟子某心猨纵欲，意马奔驰。 耳管弦鼓乐之音，欣欣有喜； 目珠翠金瑰之色，念念无忘。 悦遇纷华，爱贪奇丽。 喧华淫佚，居中不固於闺庭； 醉舞歌吟，乐外惟游於里巷。 罔念精神之凋耗，第穷筋力以疲劳。 叶脱根枯，灰飞烟灭。 致疾萦缠於喘促，传尸枉逝於伏连。 人道乖离，鬼关沦没。 殆难超度，空极吁嗟。 上来往业，见在世中。 行已灾屯，受人厌弃； 死堕地狱，长劫受苦。 苦尽复生，遂入恶道。 报尽复还，生於兹世。 以前业故，尚有余殃，受报未已。 今则闻经所说，心切惊惶，仰对圣前，恭投忏悔。 一心致敬，皈命信礼。 志心朝礼，至道集虚天尊。 志心朝礼，至神合无天尊。 志心朝礼，至清澄寂天尊。 志心朝礼，至元造化天尊。 志心朝礼，至宁含静天尊。 志心朝礼，至宝吐虚天尊。 志心朝礼，至音冠漠天尊。 志心朝礼，至无应变天尊。 志心朝礼，至柔无间天尊。 志心朝礼，至灵无待天尊。 志心朝礼，至灵若昧天尊。 志心朝礼，至强不息天尊。 志心朝礼，至盈若冲天尊。 志心朝礼，至和达常天尊。 志心朝礼，至常发明天尊。 志心朝礼，至公治事天尊。 志心朝礼，至深固本天尊。 志心朝礼，至慈施行天尊。 志心朝礼，至美流言天尊。 志心朝礼，至仁进善天尊。 志心朝礼，至惟布化天尊。 志心朝礼，至大图难天尊。 志心朝礼，至安持和天尊。 志心朝礼，至诚不动天尊。 志心朝礼，至学过众天尊。 志心朝礼，至公辅物天尊。 志心朝礼，至智多治天尊。 志心朝礼，至式探远天尊。 志心朝礼，至顺反物天尊。 志心朝礼，至善不争天尊。 志心朝礼，至化不辞天尊。 志心朝礼，至微几圣天尊。 志心朝礼，至名不去天尊。 志心朝礼，至见无欲天尊。 志心朝礼，至圣覃恩天尊。 志心朝礼，至德太玄天尊。 志心朝礼，至真长乐天尊。 天尊上圣，礼念既周。 再竭一心，遥瞻神府。 皈命紫皇天一真庆宫、元和迁校府、北极佑圣院诸真仙众。 今日道场大众，虔叩教主，北极镇天佑圣助顺真武灵应福德真君、玉虚师相玄天上帝。 伏愿宝剑横空，旌旗拥驾。 恢弘有愿，救度无边。 今为弟子某求忏上来，所犯第三品戒淫邪败真、秽慢灵炁之罪。 先世今生，遗殃往劫，上延祖考，下逮宗姻。 或见美质，属意贪污。 或凌贫素，捉人残害。 或间喋母子，攘夺男女。 或隔断亲疏，眩惑贤良，裸露三光，秽触诸圣，背驰正道，妄起邪谋，真炁消磨，灵姿昏浊，罪将条列，恶已贯盈，挠乱灵司，纠录不已。 今凭忏力颙望宣恩，勑下考校真司、巡按府署、司非执罚典录大神，广行慈悯。 并赐赦原，求忏弟子某同法众等，遵奉玄科，入道登真戒，当行柔弱，勿为邪佞，誓从今去，内无爱想，外绝妄为。 视己同於视人，好德甚於好色。 保存元炁，一毫不敢以怀欺；
chunks.translated_text:
We now examine the Third Precept of Cultivating the True: "One must not indulge in lewdness and debauchery, defiling and profaning the numinous qi."

Yet this disciple, so-and-so, has let the mind-monkey run wild with desire and the intent-horse gallop unchecked. The ears, attuned to the sounds of pipes and drums, rejoice without cease; the eyes, captivated by the hues of kingfisher feathers and golden treasures, harbor thoughts that never fade. Delighting in splendor and luxury, craving the rare and exquisite, one wallows in dissipation and excess, failing to secure the inner chamber of the household. Drunken dancing and singing, revelry beyond the home—wandering through streets and alleys—one neglects the withering of spirit and vitality, exhausting sinew and strength to the point of fatigue. Like leaves falling from a withered root, like ashes scattered and smoke dispersed, illness clings with labored breath, and the wasting curse of *chuanshi* claims one untimely. The human Dao is forsaken, the ghostly gate engulfed. Scarcely can one be delivered; in vain, one sighs in lament.

All these past transgressions manifest in this present life. In conduct, calamity and misfortune arise; in others’ eyes, one is despised and shunned. In death, one plunges into hell, suffering through long kalpas. When suffering ends, one is reborn, only to enter evil destinies. When retribution is exhausted, one returns to this world, yet due to past karma, residual misfortune remains, and the cycle of suffering persists.

Now, having heard the scriptures’ admonitions, the heart trembles in alarm. Before the sacred presence, we humbly offer repentance. With wholehearted reverence, we bow in faith and devotion:

With devoted hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of Accord Returning to All Things.

With devoted hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of Perception Without Desire.
With devoted hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Sacred Extending Grace.
With devoted hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of Virtue and the Great Mystery.
With devoted hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the True and Ever-Joyous.

Heavenly Worthies and Exalted Sages, our reverent recitations now complete, we once more devote our whole hearts, gazing afar toward the divine abodes. We bow in homage to the Purple Sovereign of the Heavenly One’s Palace of True Felicity, the Court of Primordial Harmony and Karmic Adjustment, the Northern Culmen’s Hall of Protective Sagacity, and all the perfected immortals therein.

Today, the great assembly of this Daoist sanctuary humbly invokes the Teaching Master, the Northern Culmen’s Heaven-Pacifying, Sagely-Assisting, and Blessing-Conferring True Martial Spirit-Efficacious and Virtue-Rich Perfected Lord, the Jade Void’s Preceptor and Mysterious Heavenly Thearch. We pray that the sacred sword cross the heavens and banners escort the divine chariot, that vast vows be fulfilled and boundless salvation extended.

Now, on behalf of disciple so-and-so, we seek repentance for the transgressions of the Third Precept—lewdness and debauchery defiling the true and profaning the numinous qi. From past lives to this present existence, from lingering misfortunes of former kalpas, extending upward to ancestors and forebears, downward to clan and kin—some, upon seeing beauty, fix their minds on greed and defilement; some, oppressing the poor and humble, seize and harm others; some, sowing discord between mother and child, plunder men and women; some, severing bonds of kinship, bewilder and corrupt the worthy and good. They expose the Three Luminaries to filth, defile the myriad sages, turn from the true Dao, and recklessly devise wicked schemes. Their true qi dissipates, their numinous essence grows dim and turbid. Their sins, enumerated like branches, have amassed to fill the measure of evil. They disturb the numinous bureaus, whose records of transgressions never cease.

Now, relying on the power of repentance, we gaze upward in hope of proclaimed mercy. We pray that the august decree be issued to the True Bureau of Karmic Examination, the Patrol and Inspection Offices, the Departments of Transgression, Punishment, and Record-Keeping, and all the great deities, that they widely extend compassion and grant absolution. For the repentant disciple so-and-so and the assembly of fellow practitioners, we vow to uphold the mysterious precepts, enter the Dao, and ascend to perfection. We shall practice gentleness and weakness, never engaging in wickedness or deceit. From this day forward, we swear to banish all thoughts of desire within and cease all reckless actions without. We shall regard others as ourselves and value virtue above beauty. We shall preserve the primordial qi, not daring to harbor the slightest deceit in our hearts.

chunks.original_text: 净瀹真心，万虑悉消而自守。 即斯发露，径此忏陈。 伏愿天地水府之霁威，上中下尸之释罪。 身康气定，志得愿从。 妙化弘敷，永锡绵洪之祉； 至灵不昧，庶全覆佑之休。 常奉至真，永依玄教，以斯利益，遍悉庄严。 国底蕃昌，民臻泰定。 坐蔑抗衡之变，行占奠枕之欢。 乐业安居，宁有诈祖之习，祈天永寿，曾何骇马之虞。 一切有情，同登道岸。 北极真武普慈度世法忏卷之三竟 北极真武普慈度世法忏卷之四 步虚 尔时，妙行真人告诸仙曰：在昔，元始天尊生於太无之先，禀自然之炁，冲虚凝邈，莫知其极。 天地沦坏，劫数终尽，而天尊之体常存不灭，或在玉京之上，或在穷桑之野，授以秘道，谓之开劫度人。 然开劫非一度矣。 原夫太上以龙汉元年分身降於中央大福堂国，出真文赤书，以化国民，人皆长生。 又於南极赤明之国出火炼真文，故号洞阳之庭，有流火之池，凡炼其形，皆成金色。 上立朱陵之馆，以主生成。 又於东极碧落之天浮黎之国，书真文於空青之林，遂成紫字。 其林风度成音，鸟食其叶，身生文彩； 人得其羽，即能飞行。
chunks.translated_text:
Having purified and cleansed the true heart, all myriad cares dissolve, and one guards the self in stillness. By this very confession and revelation, we now present our repentance.

We humbly pray that the majestic might of the Heaven, Earth, and Water Palaces will clear their wrath, and that the upper, middle, and lower *corporeal spirits* will release their transgressions. May the body thrive with settled qi, and the will attain its desires as vows are fulfilled. May the wondrous transformation widely unfold, eternally bestowing boundless blessings; may the supreme numen remain unobscured, fully granting its encompassing protection and grace.

Ever revering the Most Perfect, we shall forever follow the Mysterious Teachings. Through these benefits, may all be adorned with majesty. May the realm flourish in prosperity, and the people attain peace and stability. May we sit free from the turmoil of defiance, and walk in the joy of undisturbed repose. Rejoicing in our vocations and dwelling in tranquility, may no deceitful or rebellious habits arise. Praying for eternal longevity, what fear shall we have of the alarm of war-horses? May all sentient beings together ascend the shore of the Dao.

*Concluding the third scroll of the* Northern Dipper True Warrior’s Universal Compassion and Salvation Dharma Repentance.
*Beginning the fourth scroll of the* Northern Dipper True Warrior’s Universal Compassion and Salvation Dharma Repentance.

**Pacing the Void**

At that time, the Wondrous Conduct Perfected addressed the assembly of immortals, saying: In ancient times, the Most High Lord of the Primordial Beginning was born before the Great Non-Being, receiving the qi of spontaneity. Profound and serene, boundless and unfathomable, none knew its limit. When heaven and earth collapsed and the kalpa’s reckoning reached its end, the body of the Heavenly Worthy alone endured, indestructible. Sometimes dwelling above the Jade Capital, sometimes in the wilds of Qiongsang, he transmitted the secret Dao, calling it *Opening the Kalpa to Save Beings*. Yet the opening of the kalpa was not a single occasion.

Originally, in the first year of the Dragon Han era, the Most High divided his body and descended upon the Central Land of Great Blessing, revealing the True Writ in Red Script to transform the people of the realm, so that all attained longevity. Later, in the Southern Dipper’s Land of Vermilion Brightness, he revealed the True Writ of Fire Refinement, thus named the Court of Cavernous Yang, where flowed a Pool of Flowing Fire. All who refined their forms within it turned golden. Above stood the Crimson Mound’s abode, governing generation and transformation.

Again, in the Eastern Dipper’s Azure Vault of the Floating Black Realm, he inscribed the True Writ upon the Forest of Empty Azure, whereupon it became characters of purple. As the wind passed through the forest, it produced sound; birds that ate its leaves grew patterned plumage. Those who obtained their feathers could then fly.

chunks.original_text: 其民长生，安乐无为。 又於西极卫罗世界西那玉国，出真文於浮罗之岳，以度国人。 玉池自生金精，流映人挹。 其水身生金光，与天相逼。 又於北方郁单之国，出真文於洞灵之观，以度兆民。 其下寒池灵津，自然流澳。 人得饮之，无有终极。 五土之内，皆禀太上灵宝之教，以得长生。 因命五老上帝，以镇五方，行道立教，和宁群品。 臣等恭闻天尊上圣，垂大慈之化，造立天地，剖判三才，令得受生人中，莫知所自。 仰披典诰，实深负荷之恩。 倾向虔诚，五体投地。 稽首高真，皈依敬礼。 志心朝礼，虚无自然元始天尊。 志心朝礼，玉宸道君灵宝天尊。 志心朝礼，太上老君道德天尊。 志心朝礼，玉虚师相玄天上帝。 志心朝礼，圣父明真大帝。 志心朝礼，圣母琼真上仙。 志心朝礼，圣师丰乾大帝。 志心朝礼，西国紫玄元君。 志心朝礼，金阙化身天尊。 志心朝礼，玄元显应天尊。 志心朝礼，太清灵变天尊。 志心朝礼，高上玉真天尊。 志心朝礼，日光开瑞天尊。 志心朝礼，武曲应化天尊。 志心朝礼，虚星应化天尊。 志心朝礼，危星应化天尊。 志心朝礼，天乙应化天尊。 志心朝礼，太乙应化天尊。 志心朝礼，辰星应化天尊。 臣等志心皈身，皈神皈命，玄天应灵显化，诸尊上圣。 臣恭承太上垂训曰：道有悟迷，言有浮伪。 凡人三业，内则在心，外则因口。 心间所有恶业，若口不能谈，其恶亦不彰。 心间虽无其事，口中妄有巧言。 其业渐深，皆因恶口，斗谋良善，谗谮愚痴，曲说华词，妄谈谬误，不省正教，不诵仙经，装饰非言，是名败坏。 若能口不作罪，意集希言，不言於恶口之中，回向於赞咏之上，即得常近经教，赞一善以报。 谨按修真第四品戒，不得败人成功，析交离亲。 以今弟子某窃恐受性以来，至于今日，多起嫌疑，默怀嫉妬，秪为利己，奚恤危人。 孽其短而弃其长，旁觇有过； 怒彼成而喜彼败，深讶无功。 诱引姻眷於燕齐，游说朋侪於昊越。 巧言令色，但面是而背非； 谋为不忠，徒心传而口授。 道听而涂说，隙窥而墙从。 将有为无，架虚作实。 不及者，妄加訾毁； 多能者，曲肆损亏。 隔绝往还，结成怨恶。 上来往业，见在世中，艰辛一己，忧虑百端，死堕地狱，长劫受苦。 苦尽复生，生於兹世。 以前业报，尚有余殃，受报未已，今则闻经所说，大可惊惶。 仰对圣前，恭投忏悔。 人各运诚，虔心朝礼。 志心朝礼，一元混成天尊。 志心朝礼，一生有始天尊。 志心朝礼，一行柔慈天尊。 志心朝礼，一约俭约天尊。 志心朝礼，一持谦让天尊。 志心朝礼，一致无为天尊。 志心朝礼，一名可论天尊。 志心朝礼，一常三复天尊。 志心朝礼，一性无常天尊。 志心朝礼，一灵悟境天尊。 志心朝礼，一能摄善天尊。 志心朝礼，一形成势天尊。 志心朝礼，一器畜物天尊。 志心朝礼，一智明守天尊。 志心朝礼，一利济动天尊。 志心朝礼，一已袭常天尊。 志心朝礼，一真赋体天尊。 志心朝礼，一善润家天尊。 志心朝礼，一庆资乡天尊。 志心朝礼，一政护国天尊。 志心朝礼，一言善应天尊。 志心朝礼，一施不恃天尊。 志心朝礼，一切不履天尊。 志心朝礼，一弃三绝天尊。 志心朝礼，一事从容天尊。 志心朝礼，一中有信天尊。

Its people attained long life, dwelling in peace and non-action. Again, in the Western Dipper’s Wei Luo World, within the Land of Xi Na Yu, he revealed the True Writ upon the Floating Luo Peak to deliver the people of that realm. A jade pool spontaneously generated golden essence, its flowing radiance drawn by all who approached. Those who bathed in its waters emanated golden light, rivaling the brilliance of heaven. Further, in the northern Land of Yu Dan, he revealed the True Writ within the Cavernous Spirit Abbey to deliver the multitudes. Beneath it lay the Frigid Pool of Numinous Springs, its pure currents flowing naturally. All who drank therefrom knew no end to their days. Within the Five Lands, all received the teachings of the Supreme Numinous Treasure, thereby attaining long life. Thus were the Five Elder Thearchs commanded to guard the Five Directions, establishing the Dao and founding its teachings, harmonizing and pacifying all beings.

We, your servants, reverently hear that the Heavenly Worthy, the Most Sagely, extends the transformation of great compassion, creating and establishing heaven and earth, dividing and ordering the Three Powers, granting birth among humankind—yet none know their origin. Gazing upon the sacred canons, we are deeply indebted to this boundless grace. With utmost sincerity, we prostrate ourselves, bodies and minds wholly devoted. Bowing our heads to the Lofty Perfected, we take refuge and pay reverence.

We, your servants, with single-minded devotion, take refuge in body, spirit, and destiny, to the Mysterious Heaven’s Responsive Numinous Manifestation and all the Most Sagely Heavenly Worthies.

We reverently receive the Supreme’s admonition: the Dao may be awakened to or deluded by; words may be superficial or deceitful. For all people, the three karmic actions—internally, they reside in the mind; externally, they arise from the mouth. If the mind harbors evil karma yet the mouth does not speak of it, that evil remains unmanifest. Though the mind may hold no such intent, the mouth may recklessly utter cunning words. Such karma deepens, all stemming from an evil tongue—scheming against the good, slandering the foolish, twisting words with florid speech, recklessly spreading falsehoods, neglecting proper teachings, failing to recite immortal scriptures, adorning falsehoods with embellishment—this is called ruin.

If one can refrain from sinning with the mouth, gathering thoughts in rare speech, avoiding evil words and turning instead to praise and chanting, one shall ever draw near to the scriptural teachings, repaying with the praise of a single virtue.

According to the fourth precept of the *Cultivation of Perfection*, one must not undermine another’s success or sow discord among kin. Now, we disciples, fearing that from the moment of our nature’s reception until this day, we have harbored resentment and envy, acting solely for self-interest, heedless of others’ peril. We have seized upon faults while ignoring virtues, scrutinizing others’ flaws; resented others’ success and rejoiced in their failure, deeply dismayed by their lack of merit. We have lured relatives to Yan and Qi, persuaded friends to journey through Wu and Yue. With honeyed words and false smiles, we have feigned agreement while harboring deceit; schemed disloyally, transmitting thoughts only through heart and mouth. We have repeated hearsay as truth, spied through cracks to climb walls. We have turned being into non-being, fabricated emptiness as reality. Those who fell short, we slandered without cause; those of great talent, we maliciously diminished. We have severed ties, fostering enmity and hatred. chunks.original_text: 今为弟子某求忏上来所犯第四品戒败人成功、析交离亲之罪，先世今生，遗殃往劫，上延祖考，下逮宗亲，见利忘义而败坏功劳，背恩绝爱而隔断亲友。 暗生巇崄，潜设机关。 或交合妄起於纷争，或謟佞横生於间越。 递传虚语，矫饰诈情，惟务图谋，是名障碍。 罪将条列，恶已贯盈，挠乱灵司，纠录不已。 今凭忏力，颙望宣恩，劫下上天星地、四时五行、六律七星、司功考过、一切神司仙曹主吏，广行慈悯，并赐赦原。 求忏弟子某同法众等，遵奉玄科，入道登真戒，当行无妄，勿为谄诈，誓从今去，言无口过，行务已修，视人犹己之非殊，推功让能而不伐。 上和下睦，俾成勋绩之隆； 内抚外宁，肯使亲疏之间。
chunks.translated_text:
Today, on behalf of the disciple [Name], we seek repentance for the transgressions of the fourth precept—undermining others’ success and sowing discord among kin—sins committed in past lives and this present existence, extending their baleful influence upward to ancestors and downward to clan and kin. For the sake of gain, righteousness was forgotten, and meritorious deeds were ruined; through betrayal of gratitude and severing of affection, bonds of kinship and friendship were broken. In darkness, treacherous schemes were laid; in secret, snares were set. At times, reckless alliances gave rise to strife; at others, flattery and deceit spread dissension. Falsehoods were passed along in turn, emotions feigned and truth distorted—all in pursuit of scheming and plotting, which is called obstruction. The litany of offenses is long, and the weight of evil has reached its full measure, disturbing the divine bureaus and drawing ceaseless scrutiny and record.

Now, relying on the power of repentance, we lift our gaze in hope of proclaimed mercy, beseeching the stellar and terrestrial deities of the heavens and earth across kalpas, the four seasons and five phases, the six pitch-pipes and seven stars, the offices of merit and transgression, and all divine administrators and immortal clerks: may you widely extend compassion and grant full pardon. The repentant disciple [Name], together with this assembly of the Dharma, upholds the mysterious statutes, enters the Dao, and ascends to the precepts of truth. We vow henceforth to act without deceit, to refrain from flattery and fraud, to swear from this day forward that our words shall be free of fault, our conduct devoted to self-cultivation, and that we shall regard others’ wrongs as our own, yielding credit and deferring to ability without boasting. May harmony above and concord below bring about the flourishing of great achievements; may inner peace and outer stability ensure that no rift arises between near and distant kin.

Having completed this litany of reverence, they once more devote their whole hearts, remotely beseeching the divine court of the Purple Sovereign’s Heavenly One True Felicity Palace, the Bureau of Primordial Harmony and Transcendent Judgment, and the Northern Culmen’s Hall of Protective Sages—all the perfected immortals and celestial hosts. Today, the assembly of this ritual site humbly invokes the teaching master, the Northern Culmen’s Heaven-Filling Protective Sage, the True Martial Spirit of Assisting Rectitude and Blessing Virtue, the Jade Void Preceptor, the Mysterious Heavenly Thearch.

May their auspicious radiance descend, their blessed presence alight, bestowing grace upon the multitude, absolving grievances, and mitigating punishments. Now, on behalf of disciples such as ourselves, we repent for the transgressions of the fifth precept—displaying talent to exalt ourselves and slandering the good—committed in past lives and the present, leaving calamities across past kalpas, afflicting our ancestors above and descendants below. With sharp wit, we belittled the gentle and magnanimous; with our skills, we mocked and derided the mediocre and unrefined. Swaggering in self-satisfaction, we scorned all before us. Where power failed to bend others, resentment and grievances arose.

Where words grew fawning and obsequious, mockery and scorn arose. Recognizing only ourselves, we acted as though none stood beside us. Our self-regard soared too high, our arrogance and deceit grew ever bolder. Sins now stand tall in their tally, evil has filled its measure, disturbing the numinous bureaus, whose records of transgressions never cease.

Today, we rely upon repentance, openly beseeching the bestowal of grace. May the edict descend to the embroidered-robed messengers under your command, the Recording Deities Supreme, the yin-yang magistrates of the eight directions and nine provinces, the clerks and functionaries of all offices, and every luminous spirit. May they widely extend their compassion and mercy, granting universal pardon and absolution.

We, the repentant disciples, together with the assembly of the Dharma, reverently uphold the Mysterious Precepts, entering the Dao and ascending to true realization. We shall observe the rules with utmost care, never placing ourselves first. From this day forward, we vow to practice reverence and fulfill propriety to the utmost. We shall harmonize our light and mingle with the dust, never boasting lest none contend with our abilities. Upon witnessing goodness, we shall act as though we have not yet attained it. In humility and modesty, we shall withdraw, casting aside all pretension and deceit. In forthrightness and forbearance, we shall seal off all wayward and errant thoughts.

Having thus confessed and repented, we pray that the Emperor’s grace may descend in abundance, and the August Majesty’s power may ascend and flow unimpeded. May the four seasons forever dispel hardship, and the entire household together attain peace and prosperity. May we walk without shame, relying entirely upon your protection and aid. May your illumination remain unwavering, and may we never conceal our conduct. We shall forever serve the Supreme Truth, eternally follow the Mysterious Teachings. Through these benefits, may all be adorned with majesty. May the hundred grains ripen in abundance, the five materials be fully utilized. May the scourge of drought and locusts be swept away, and the calamity of becoming fish and turtles be averted. May there be ample food and clothing, no suffering from hunger or cold. May there be abundant millet and hemp, inspiring gratitude and reverence for the power of virtue. May all sentient beings together ascend the shore of the Dao.

*Thus concludes the fifth scroll of the Northern Dipper True Martial’s Universal Compassion and Salvation Dharma Repentance.*

At that time, the Wondrous Conduct Perfected One addressed the assembly of immortals, saying: Long ago, the Female Perfected One Wang Miaoxiang of Mount Jiuyi, in her ardent devotion and sincerity, suddenly experienced a vision. One day, auspicious clouds filled the courtyard, and radiant light illuminated the hall and altar. Banners and canopies descended from the sky, and a Heavenly Official, clad in feathered robes and a jeweled crown, ascended the hall and took his seat. He said to Miaoxiang, “I am the Lord Shun, sovereign of the ancient Youyu dynasty. Having wearied of governing the myriad states, I cultivated the Dao upon this mountain. I have long wished to instruct later generations, guiding them to comprehend the Way, yet in this world, none are fit to receive such teaching.”

chunks.original_text: 夫道在於内，不在於外。 道在尔身，不在他人。 玄经所谓修之於身，其德乃真。 近者，地司所奏，汝守道不邪，遵禀玄戒，若无所证，乃道之弃人也。 又玄经云，常善救物，故无弃物，而道之布惠周遍，则物物皆欲成之，人人皆欲度之。 但世人福果卑微，道炁肤浅，不能精专，勤学道业，未就而已。 中怠是人自弃道，非道弃人。 盖上圣高真，愍历劫不常代运，流转阴阳，倚伏生死，推迁俄尔之间。 至阳九百六之会，孜孜下教，以救於人，尤切於世人之求道也。 然世人求道也，若存若亡，系念存心，万中无一。 天真愍俗，常在人间，隐影化形，随方开悟。 子欲长生，三一当明。 子能守一，一亦守子矣，能变为精，精变为婴儿，婴儿上为真人，真人然后为亦子，此是真人一也。 又曰伪道养形，真道养神，神真道通，能亡能存，神能飞形，亦能移山，形受灰土，其何识焉。 身目声色，为子留愆。 鼻口所喜，香味是冤，身为恼本，痛痒寒温，意为形累。 愁毒忧烦，弗疾去之，则志气自耗，寿命不延。 臣等钦惟上圣，哀救世人、广示训章，开度群品。 当遵品戒，竭心修习，负荷至恩，不胜惭激。 一心发念，五体倾依。 稽首慈尊，敬礼真圣。 志心朝礼，虚无自然元始天尊。 志心朝礼，玉宸道君灵宝天尊。 志心朝礼，太上老君道德天尊。 志心朝礼，法主玄天仁威上帝。 志心朝礼，圣父明真大帝。 志心朝礼，圣母琼真上仙。 志心朝礼，圣师丰乾大帝。 志心朝礼，西国紫玄元君。 志心朝礼，金阙化身天尊。 志心朝礼，玄元显应天尊。 志心朝礼，太清灵变天尊。 志心朝礼，日光开瑞天尊。 志心朝礼，武曲应化天尊。 志心朝礼，虚星应化天尊。 志心朝礼，危星应化天尊。 志心朝礼，天一应化天尊。 志心朝礼，太一应化天尊。 志心朝礼，辰星庆化天尊。 臣等志心皈身，皈神皈命，玄天应灵显化诸尊。 臣等恭承经宝，太上垂训曰，斋戒者，道之根本，法之津梁。 子欲学道，清斋奉戒，念念正真，邪妄自泯。 一切众生，舍清净域，耽嗜荤膻，而以触法。 譬如饿鬼啖食死尸，火烧饥肠，饥肠无饱。 又如蝇虫争夺臭腐，妄为膻香，而以触法，三宫溷浊，六腑不净，尸魄欣昌，乐於死地。 子当割嗜欲根，入真净境，无作诸苦，无造诸恶，无生诸见，无犯诸邪。 子观戒文，如世法律，欲有所犯，惧金木刑。 子於戒文，精意奉持，凛然在前，如对所畏，秉心正严，灭一切想，谛听不二，可会正真，是吾弟子也。 谨按修真第六品戒云，不得饮酒过差，食诸厌物。 以今弟子某等切虑，纵心侈欲，玩意贪观。 量吸鲸吞，日夕第从於酩酊； 味耽鸩毒，岁时惟喜於腥膻。 假名乎，仙境之琼浆； 求异乎，贵家之玉食。 忘形嗜好，适兴肥甘。 百醉千场，裸袒转成於放旷； 五辛六厌，啖尝务在於饱充。 秽气烁人，沈酗乱性。 举动第多於狂惑，语言罔顾於淫邪。 矧当斋礿之辰，偏起歼残之念。 但资口腹，不谨身躯。 遍街握腕以潜行，秽室蹑踪而竞往。 所为不择，其处非良，践履既亏，设施徒谬。 上来往业，见在世中，立身谫薄，举事卑污，死堕地狱，长劫受苦，苦尽复生，遂入恶道，报尽复还，生於兹世。 以前业故，尚有余殃，受报未已，今则闻经所说，大可惊惶。
chunks.translated_text:
The Dao resides within, not without. The Dao lies in your own person, not in another. As the Mysterious Canon states: "Cultivate it within yourself, and your virtue shall be true." Recently, the Earthly Bureau memorialized that you have guarded the Dao without deviation, adhering to the Mysterious Precepts. If you attain no realization, it is the Dao that abandons the person.

Moreover, the Mysterious Canon declares: "Ever skillfully deliver all beings, thus nothing is abandoned." As the Dao’s beneficence pervades all, every being longs for fulfillment, and every person yearns for deliverance. Yet worldly beings, their karmic fruits meager and their Dao-qi shallow, fail to concentrate single-mindedly and diligently study the Dao’s work. Before completion, they grow lax—this is the person abandoning the Dao, not the Dao abandoning the person.

The Supreme Sages and Lofty Perfected Ones, moved by compassion for those who endure kalpas of impermanence—cycling through yin and yang, subject to rise and fall, birth and death, all shifting in an instant—especially during the conjunctions of the Nine Nines and Hundred Sixes, tirelessly descend to teach, striving to save humanity. Yet when worldly beings seek the Dao, their minds waver between presence and absence, and among ten thousand, scarcely one maintains steadfast mindfulness.

The Heavenly Perfected Ones, pitying the worldly, ever dwell among mortals, concealing their forms and transforming their appearances to enlighten all directions. If you desire long life, the Three Ones must be made clear. If you can guard the One, the One will guard you in turn. It transforms into essence, essence into the infant, the infant ascends to become a Perfected One, and the Perfected One then becomes the Celestial Child—this is the true One of the Perfected One.

It is also said: "The false Dao nurtures the form; the true Dao nurtures the spirit. When the spirit is true, the Dao is penetrated; it can vanish and endure. The spirit can make the form fly or move mountains, but when the form is reduced to ashes and dust, what awareness remains?"

The eyes and forms, sounds and colors—these are the faults that bind you. The fragrances and flavors your nose and mouth crave—these are your foes. The body is the root of affliction: pain, itching, cold, and warmth. The mind is burdened by the form; sorrow, poison, worry, and vexation—if you do not swiftly cast them aside, your will and qi will naturally deplete, and your lifespan will not extend.

We, your humble servants, reverently consider how the Supreme Sages, moved by compassion for worldly beings, have broadly revealed these teachings to deliver all ranks. We must uphold the precepts of our rank, devote ourselves wholeheartedly to cultivation, and bear the profound grace with utmost shame and gratitude.

With single-minded devotion, our five limbs bow in reverence. We prostrate before the Merciful Venerable One and pay homage to the True Sages:

With devout hearts, we bow to the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void and Spontaneity.
With devout hearts, we bow to the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Jade Clarity Dao Lord.
With devout hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Dao and Its Virtue, the Most High Lord Lao.
With devout hearts, we bow to the August Emperor of Dark Heaven, Lord of Benevolence and Might.
With devout hearts, we bow to the Radiant Perfected Great Emperor, the Sacred Father.
With devout hearts, we bow to the Jade Perfected Supreme Immortal, the Sacred Mother.
With devout hearts, we bow to the Sacred Master, the August Emperor of Abundant Heaven.
With devout hearts, we bow to the Purple Profundity Primordial Lady of the Western Realm.
With devout hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Golden Watchtower’s Incarnation.
With devout hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Manifest Response of the Primordial.
With devout hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Numinous Transformations of the Great Clarity.
With devout hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Auspicious Radiance of the Sun.
With devout hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Martial Star’s Response and Transformation.
With devout hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Void Star’s Response and Transformation.
With devout hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Danger Star’s Response and Transformation.
With devout hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Celestial One’s Response and Transformation.
With devout hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Great One’s Response and Transformation.
With devout hearts, we bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Auspicious Transformation of the Chrono Star.

We, your humble servants, with devout hearts, take refuge in body, spirit, and life, reverently submitting to the manifold Perfected Ones of Dark Heaven’s Responsive Numinosity.

We reverently receive the sacred scriptures, wherein the Most High has proclaimed: "Fasting and precepts are the root of the Dao and the bridge of the Dharma. If you wish to study the Dao, observe purity and uphold the precepts, maintaining right mindfulness in every thought—thus, deviance and delusion will naturally vanish."

All sentient beings, forsaking the realm of purity, indulge in the stench of flesh and blood, thereby transgressing the Dharma. Like hungry ghosts devouring corpses, their burning bellies find no satiety; like flies swarming over filth, they mistake stench for fragrance, thereby transgressing the Dharma. The Three Palaces grow turbid, the Six Viscera impure; the corpse-spirit rejoices in corruption, delighting in the realm of death.

You must sever the roots of desire, enter the true realm of purity, refrain from all suffering, avoid all evil, abandon all views, and shun all deviance. Regard the precepts as you would the laws of the world: if you contemplate transgression, you fear the punishments of metal and wood. Hold fast to the precepts with utmost sincerity, maintaining solemn reverence as if facing something dreadful. With upright mind and strict discipline, extinguish all thoughts, listen with undivided attention, and you may attain the true and right—such is my disciple.

According to the sixth precept of the *Cultivation of the Perfected*: "Do not overindulge in alcohol or consume impure things." We, your disciples, deeply fear that we have indulged our hearts in excess and desire, indulging our senses in greed and observation. Like whales swallowing the ocean, we daily and nightly succumb to drunkenness; like birds relishing poison, we yearn for the stench of flesh through the seasons. Under the pretense of "celestial nectar of the immortal realms" or in pursuit of "exquisite delicacies of the noble households," we forget our forms in pursuit of taste and pleasure.

A hundred drunken bouts, a thousand scenes—stripped bare, we grow ever more dissolute. The Five Pungents and Six Impurities fill our mouths, our only aim to sate our hunger. Foul vapors scorch others, deep intoxication disorders the nature. Our actions grow ever more frenzied, our words heedless of lewdness and deviance. Even during the sacred times of fasting and offering, we harbor thoughts of slaughter and gluttony. We serve only our mouths and bellies, neglecting the body’s discipline.

We slink through the streets, wringing our hands in secret, or tread stealthily to filthy chambers, competing to arrive. Our conduct is indiscriminate, our haunts unwholesome; our steps falter, our efforts are in vain. The karmic deeds of the past persist in this life: we establish ourselves in meagerness, our actions base and vile. Upon death, we fall into hell, suffering for long kalpas. When the suffering ends, we are reborn, only to enter evil destinies. When that retribution is exhausted, we return to this world. Due to past karma, lingering misfortunes remain, and the cycle of suffering continues—until now, hearing the scriptures’ teachings, we are truly alarmed and terrified.

chunks.original_text: 今为弟子某忏除上来所犯六品戒云饮酒过差，食诸厌物之罪，先世今生，遗殃往劫，上延祖考，下逮宗亲。 沉酣不已而溺志疏强，游宴无度而裸身废礼。 喜烹异味，不知厌触之愆； 故杀含灵，专事脍炙之美。 夸恃酒圣，宰戮物牲，亵慢高真，难逃重谴，罪将条列，恶已贯盈，挠乱灵司，纠录不已。 今凭忏悔，颙望宣恩，勑下九府业道治罪冥官、主录曹僚，灵司掾吏、执法大神，广行慈悯，并赐赦原。 求忏弟子某同法众等，遵奉玄科，入道登真戒，常行清净，勿矜污俗，澄神净虑，约己存神，饮无过多，食无厌秽。 守皆醉独醒之悔，微以借红； 循养生送死之规，资之斑白。
chunks.translated_text:
Today, on behalf of the disciple [Name], we repent the transgressions of the six precepts—excess in wine-drinking and the consumption of impure substances—sins accrued from past lives to the present, from former kalpas to this generation, extending upward to ancestors and downward to clan kin. Through ceaseless intoxication, resolve has drowned and will grown weak; through boundless feasting, the body has been bared and rites abandoned. Fond of cooking rare delicacies, one remains unaware of the offense in slaughter; wantonly killing sentient beings, one indulges in the pleasures of minced flesh. Boasting of wine’s sagacity, beasts are butchered; disrespecting the lofty Perfected, heavy retribution is inescapable. Offenses mount in tally, evil brims to overflowing, disturbing the numinous bureaus, whose records never cease.

Now, relying on repentance, we lift our gaze in hope of proclaimed mercy, entreating the nine bureaus of karmic judgment, the underworld officials, the clerks of the Registry, the divine functionaries, and the enforcing deities—may they, in vast compassion, grant absolution. The repentant disciple [Name], together with this assembly, pledges to uphold the Mysterious Statutes, enter the Dao, ascend to Perfection’s precepts, and ever practice purity. Let us not vaunt worldly defilement, but clarify the spirit and purify the mind, restrain the self and preserve the numinous. Drink without excess, eat without impurity. Let us guard against the regret of the lone sober amidst the drunken, borrowing the crimson’s warning; follow the principles of nurturing life and sending off the dead, drawing upon the silver-haired’s wisdom.

chunks.original_text: 即斯发露，径此忏陈。 伏愿泽沛乾坤，恩垂雨露。 原宥颠狂之谴，鉴观改悔之私。 惠及草莱，咸享安康之乐； 光浮蓬华，永消暗昧之虞。 常奉至真，永依玄教，以斯利益，遍悉妆严，国治民安，莫匪平宁而置器； 官清道泰，曾何凌犯以争衡。 一切有情，俱登道岸。 北极真武普慈度世法忏卷之六竟 北极真武普慈度世法忏卷之七 步虚 尔时，妙行真人告诸仙曰：昔，太上显号静老天尊，行教五方，开度人天，乃先天地，以资万类。 上处玉京，为神王之宗； 下在紫微，为飞仙之祖。 千变万化，有德不德，随机应物，厥迹无常。 授轩辕於崆峒，教帝喾於牧德。 大禹承长生之诀，尹喜受道德之旨。 丹书紫字，升玄飞步之经； 玉石金光，妙有洞灵之说。 如此之文，不可胜纪。 自上古历劫至黄帝、帝喾、夏禹，并遇神人，咸受道箓。 年代既久，经史无闻，迨及姬周，东辞函谷，西入罽宾。 见恍惚之容，演希夷之训。 是以善利西方，化流中国。 且夫人之生也，天傅之以神，地傅之以精，中和傅之以炁。 人能保精、爱神、护炁，内则致身长生，外则致国太平。 故为人臣者，当上忠其君，欲其长生； 为人子者，当念父母，惧其将老； 为人弟子者，当念师恩。 盖受身於父母，成道德於真师，得水土之养於君尊。 当念君父师之将老，无以复之。 或行学修善，更师贤明求，奇才异术，而资益之。 此乃太古上皇，尝令修善之人，言行精实，心自克责，洗心易行，感动上玄，受天地恩，不忘报谢。 精专弗怠，得致神仙。 臣等幻化生身，叨承盖载，君亲宠渥，父母劬劳，得佩训章，敢忘所自。 式凭香火，用报洪恩。 秉躬致虔，一心发念。 稽首皈依，正真三宝。 志心朝礼，虚无自然元始天尊。 志心朝礼，玉宸道君灵宝天尊。 志心朝礼，太上老君道德天尊。 志心朝礼，玉虚师相玄天上帝。 志心朝礼，圣父明真大帝。 志心朝礼，圣母琼真上仙。 志心朝礼，圣师丰乾大帝。 志心朝礼，西国紫玄元君。 志心朝礼，金阙化身天尊。 志心朝礼，玄元显应天尊。 志心朝礼，太清灵变天尊。 志心朝礼，高上玉真天尊。 志心朝礼，日光开瑞天尊。 志心朝礼，武曲应化天尊。 志心朝礼，虚星应生天尊。 志心朝礼，危星应化天尊。 志心朝礼，天一应化天尊。 志心朝礼，太一应化天尊。 志心朝礼，辰星应化天尊。 臣等志心皈身，皈神皈命，三宝至尊玄天上帝，显灵应化诸大天尊。 臣恭闻太上垂训曰，一切众生，处在浮世，百年几日，如时饷间。 石火电光，何能得久。 如蛾扑灯，自取殒灭。 不能明了，误此萦缠。 惟怀吝惜，常负贪求。 聚积山高，心犹不足。 一日之活，作千年计。 生既不将一钱来，死亦不将一钱去。 一朝身殁，万事皆空。 无量悭贪，尽成虚幻。 在世积财不散，宁免水火盗贼之菑； 用计谋人，岂免乏绝子孙之报。 当此之时，英雄豪贵，顿尔俱消。 高车大马，何关人事。 华堂峻宇，尽属他人。 姻眷吁嗟，有何所益。 谨按修真第七品戒云，不得贪求无厌，积财不散。 重念臣等私忧过计，遐想贪图，积贮务多，贪饕何已。 兼并货贿，欲此富而彼贫； 攘取田庐，视我强而他弱。 登龙断而罔利，竞蜗角以求赢。 朝谋夕虑，而惟恐其无； 左经右营，而不满所欲。
chunks.translated_text:
Herein we lay bare our transgressions and present this repentance. May the grace of heaven and earth overflow like rain and dew. Pardon the judgments upon our madness, and perceive the sincerity of our reform. Bestow blessings upon the humble, that all may enjoy peace and well-being; let radiance suffuse the lotus, forever dispelling the shadows of ignorance. May we ever serve the Most Perfect, forever adhere to the Mysterious Teachings. Through these blessings, may all adornments be perfected, the state governed and the people at peace, none but abiding in tranquility; may officials be pure and the Dao flourish, never again contending in aggression. May all sentient beings ascend to the shore of the Dao.

*End of the Sixth Scroll of the Northern Dipper True Martial’s Universal Compassion and Salvation Dharma Repentance*
*Beginning of the Seventh Scroll of the Northern Dipper True Martial’s Universal Compassion and Salvation Dharma Repentance*

**Pacing the Void**

At that time, the Wondrously Practiced Perfected addressed the assembled immortals: "Of old, the Supreme revealed the title of the Venerable Serene Heavenly Worthy, propagating the teachings across the five directions to deliver humans and gods. Existing prior to heaven and earth, it nurtures the ten thousand kinds. Above, it dwells in the Jade Capital as the progenitor of divine kings; below, it resides in the Purple Tenuity as the ancestor of flying immortals. Undergoing a thousand transformations and ten thousand changes, it possesses virtue yet does not claim virtue, responding to circumstances and adapting to beings, its traces ever without constancy. It instructed the Yellow Emperor at Mount Kongtong, taught Emperor Ku in his herding of virtue. Great Yu received the formula for long life, Yin Xi received the purport of the *Dao and Its Virtue*. Crimson script on cinnabar, the *Scripture of Ascending the Mysterious and Pacing the Void*; golden light on jade and stone, the wondrous *Exposition of the Numinous and Profound*. Such texts are beyond enumeration. From high antiquity through the kalpas to the Yellow Emperor, Emperor Ku, and Great Yu, all encountered divine beings and received the registers of the Dao. As the ages grew distant, records and histories fell silent, until the Zhou dynasty, when [the Dao] departed east from Hangu Pass and entered the western lands of Jibin. There, it revealed its evanescent form and expounded the teachings of the Subtle and Inaudible. Thus, beneficence flowed westward and transformation spread through the Middle Kingdom.

Now, when a person is born, heaven endows them with spirit, earth endows them with essence, and the harmonious center endows them with qi. If one can preserve essence, cherish spirit, and safeguard qi, internally this leads to long life, externally to the peace of the state. Therefore, as a minister, one should be loyal to one’s lord, desiring his long life; as a child, one should bear in mind one’s parents, fearing their aging; as a disciple, one should remember the grace of one’s teacher. For we receive our bodies from our parents, perfect our virtue and power through true teachers, and obtain the sustenance of water and soil from our sovereign. We ought to bear in mind the aging of our lord, father, and teacher, for they cannot be restored. One may practice learning and cultivate goodness, seek out worthy and enlightened teachers, and acquire rare talents and extraordinary arts to benefit them. This was the way of the Highest Sovereigns of remote antiquity: those who cultivated goodness spoke and acted with utmost sincerity, disciplined their hearts, purified their conduct, and moved the Supreme Mystery to respond. Receiving the grace of heaven and earth, they never forgot to repay it. With unwavering dedication, they attained the ranks of the immortals.

We, though ephemeral in our incarnate forms, have presumptuously received the shelter of heaven and earth, the favor of lord and kin, the toil of our parents, and the privilege of bearing their teachings. How dare we forget our origins? Relying upon incense and flame, we repay this vast grace. Holding ourselves with reverence, we single-mindedly give rise to this vow. Bowing our heads, we take refuge in the Orthodox and True Three Treasures. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void and Spontaneity. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Jade Clarity. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of the Dao and Its Virtue, the Most High Lord Lao. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Jade Void Preceptor and Minister, the Mysterious Heavenly Thearch. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Sacred Father, the Illustrious Perfected Great Emperor. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Sacred Mother, the Jade Perfected Supreme Immortal. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Sacred Teacher, the Abundant Heavenly Great Emperor. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Purple Profundity Primordial Lady of the Western Lands. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of Transformative Manifestation of the Golden Tower. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of Manifest Response of the Mysterious Origin. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of Numinous Transformation of the Great Clarity. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of the Lofty Jade Perfection. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of Auspicious Radiance of the Solar Light. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of Martial Response and Transformation. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of Void Star Response and Birth. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of Perilous Star Response and Transformation. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of Heavenly One Response and Transformation. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of Great One Response and Transformation. With devoted hearts, we pay homage to the Heavenly Worthy of Celestial Star Response and Transformation.

We, with devoted hearts, take refuge in body, spirit, and life, in the Three Treasures and the Most High Mysterious Heavenly Thearch, and in all the Heavenly Worthies of Manifest Response and Transformation.

We have reverently heard the teachings bequeathed by the Most High: All sentient beings dwell in the floating world, where a hundred years pass like a moment. Swift as spark from stone or lightning flash, how can they endure? Like moths to flame, they court their own destruction, unable to awaken, ensnared by delusion. Clinging to stinginess, they are ever burdened by greed. Though their hoards rise like mountains, their hearts remain unsatisfied. They plan for a single day as if it were a thousand years. Born, they bring not a single coin; dead, they take not a single coin away. In a single morning, the body perishes, and all things become empty. Boundless avarice dissolves into illusion. Those who amass wealth in life without dispersing it—how can they escape the disasters of flood, fire, or bandits? Those who scheme against others—how can they avoid the retribution of impoverished descendants? At such times, heroes and the mighty vanish in an instant. Grand carriages and fine steeds—what concern are they to the deceased? Splendid halls and towering mansions—all belong to others. Kin and family lament in vain—what benefit is there?

We now reflect upon the Seventh Precept of Cultivating the Perfected: *One must not be insatiably greedy, hoarding wealth without dispersing it.* Yet we, in our private anxieties, have overreached in calculation, indulged in distant ambitions and covetous schemes, amassed stores without end, and pursued gluttony without cease. We have monopolized goods and wealth, desiring our own enrichment while impoverishing others; seized fields and homes, seeing our own strength and others’ weakness. We have blocked the dragon’s ascent to monopolize profit, vied over snail-horn gains to seek advantage. Morning to night, we scheme and worry, ever fearful of lack; left and right, we maneuver and contrive, never satisfied in our desires."

Grain and millet rot in granaries—would we spare a single kernel to relieve the starving? Cash and paper notes overflow the beams—could we part with even a fraction to aid the destitute? Our own sustenance is already deemed meager and base; how could we spare pity for the wretched and impoverished? We still seek to sweep up all, while our purses grow ever more parched.

The karmic deeds of past and present lives weigh upon us in this world: ceaseless toil and weariness, calamities of banditry and plunder. Upon death, we plunge into hell, suffering through long kalpas of torment. When that suffering ends, we are reborn—only to enter the evil destinies. When that retribution is exhausted, we return once more to this world, yet due to past karma, lingering misfortune remains, and the cycle of suffering is not yet complete.

Now, hearing the sutra’s teachings, we are struck with terror. Before the sacred presence, we humbly prostrate in repentance. With wholehearted devotion, we take refuge and pay reverence.

Heavenly Worthies and Supreme Saints, our reverence and recitation now complete, we once more devote our whole hearts to gaze afar toward the divine palaces. We take refuge in the Purple Sovereign’s Heavenly One Palace of True Felicity, the Court of Primordial Harmony and Karmic Adjustment, and the Northern Culmen’s Hall of Protective Sagacity—all the assembled immortals.

Today, the great assembly of this Daoist ritual humbly invokes the teaching master, the Northern Culmen’s Heaven-Pacifying, Sagely-Assisting, and Fate-Conforming True Martial Spirit-Efficacious and Virtue-Bestowing Perfected Sovereign, the Jade Void Preceptor and Mysterious Heavenly Thearch. We pray that, treading upon the tortoise and restraining the serpent, riding the simurgh and driving the phoenix, you may widely open your compassion and broadly succor the common and foolish.

Now, on behalf of the disciple [Name], we seek repentance for the sins of violating the Seventh Precept—insatiable greed and hoarding wealth without dispersing it—committed in past lives and the present, the lingering misfortunes of former kalpas, extending to ancestors above and descendants below. We have seized others’ wealth as our own, schemed to claim others’ possessions as our own, concealed our cunning, and wantonly deployed deceitful plans.

We have blocked the dragon’s ascent to monopolize profit, vied over snail-horn gains to seek advantage. Morning to night, we scheme and worry, ever fearful of lack; left and right, we maneuver and contrive, never satisfied in our desires."

At times, trading in the marketplace, they saw abundance as if it were nothing;
Or hoarding wealth to adorn their halls, they exchanged emptiness for substance.
Their wealth swelled to billions, yet they begrudged even the smallest coin.
Ever craving accumulation to gratify their hearts,
They heeded not that excess wealth could bring harm upon themselves.
Their sins now stand enumerated, their evil brimmed to fullness,
Disturbing the numinous bureaus, whose records ceaselessly compile their transgressions.

Today, relying on the power of repentance, we earnestly beseech the bestowal of grace,
That the Bureau of Merit be commanded to cease its reckoning of wrongs,
That the officials of Yang and the clerks of Yin, who hold the registers and grasp the ledgers,
The celestial deities who uphold the law, the luminous spirits who discern good and evil,
The assessors and their aides—all may broadly extend their compassion and grant absolution.

The repentant disciple [Name], together with the assembly of the Dharma,
Abides by the Mysterious Statutes, enters the Dao, and ascends to the True Precepts.
Henceforth, we shall practice contentment, ever uphold integrity,
And vow that from this day forward, we shall early plant the seeds of goodness,
Coveting not even the slightest gain.
Our chests and trunks shall store only what is fitting,
And our granaries need never fear depletion.
Knowing when to stop and when we have enough,
We shall cease all excessive pursuits in our affairs.
Swiftly and surely, we shall aid those in need,
Never seeking to further enrich the already wealthy.

By this open confession and sincere repentance,
We humbly pray that the boundless blessings of creation may encompass us,
That the radiance of your oversight may be no less than the sheltering heavens.
May our households enjoy flourishing fortune,
And high and low alike receive the blessings of tranquility.
May the favor of Heaven prove no empty promise,
And all, in every station, dwell in warmth and plenty.
May the sun’s bounty never fail,
And its generosity flow without end.
Ever revering the True and Orthodox,
We shall forever follow the Mysterious Teachings.
Through these merits, may all be adorned with splendor,
May the hidden and manifest realms commune,
The living and the dead alike be delivered,
The Nine Dark Realms be opened and prosper,
The Eight Difficulties be dispelled and dissolved.
May we depart the Black Path and ascend the Vermilion Palace,
Be swiftly uplifted and exalted by boundless grace,
Receive the beneficent dew and all be suffused with its blessings.

Thus concludes the Seventh Scroll of the *Northern Culmen Perfected Warrior’s Universal Compassion Dharma Repentance*.

**Pacing the Void**

At that time, the Great Mystery Perfected One, in the Golden Flower Grotto-Heaven, encountered the descent of the Most High and inquired of the Teachings Beyond Words.
The Most High replied:
Heaven attains its height, Earth its depth,
The sun shines, the stars gleam—yet none speak.
Align with the Dao, and all things are naturally so.
The four seasons proceed in their course, yet not for the sake of the myriad beings.
Rain and dew descend in their time, yet not to nurture grasses and trees.
The numinous and the yin-yang harmonize, and all things grow of themselves.

The Dao conceals its essence within,
Settles the spirit in the heart.
Serene and still, joyous and harmonious,
It fills the breast with clarity, vast and formless,
Silent and soundless.
Thus, the court enjoys peace, the government halls are tranquil,
No recluses lurk in the forests, no idle folk roam the wilds.
No forced labor, no unjust punishments—
All under Heaven look up to the virtue of their ruler.
Distant lands and foreign customs,
All come forth, their interpreters in tow,
Though no household has been visited, nor any person instructed.
It is the extension of sincere heart to all under Heaven—nothing more.

Thus, rewarding good and punishing evil are but instruments of governance.
What enables their enactment is the power of sincerity.
Though governance be clear, it cannot act alone—
It must await the permeation of sincerity.
When sincerity takes form within and without,
Pervading the hearts of the people,
This is the Teachings Beyond Words.

When the Sage abides above, embracing the Dao without speech,
His beneficence extends to the ten thousand directions.
Thus, the Teachings Beyond Words—how vast and boundless!
Therefore, the ruler’s contemplation of the numinous
Must not stray from his breast,
His wisdom need not extend beyond the four quarters.
Embracing his sincere heart,
Timely sweet rains fall, the five grains flourish,
Authority is majestic yet untested,
Laws are few yet unburdensome,
Prisons stand empty, all under Heaven share a single custom.
Auspicious clouds arise, auspicious stars appear,
Yellow dragons descend, propitious phoenixes arrive.
Sweet springs well forth, fine grains sprout,
The seas lie calm, their waves stilled.

But should one defy Heaven and oppress the myriad beings,
The sun and moon grow dim and eclipse,
The five stars stray from their courses,
The four seasons fall into discord,
Day darkens, night shines,
Mountains collapse, waters dry,
Winter thunders, summer frosts,
Celestial omens shift and portend,
The land knows no peace.
For the Dao of Heaven and Earth communicates with humanity.

The Sage harmonizes his virtue with Heaven and Earth,
His brightness with the sun and moon,
His numinosity with the ghosts and spirits,
His trustworthiness with the four seasons.
Embracing the heart of Heaven, aligning with Heaven’s qi,
Holding to the Center and harmonizing,
He need not descend his hall to traverse the Four Seas.
Transforming customs, leading all to turn toward goodness—
This is the Teachings Beyond Words.

We, your servants, born in an enlightened age,
Delight in encountering this flourishing era,
Where the land and waters of the kingdom,
Heaven and Earth shape and sustain.
Grateful for virtue, bearing grace without end,
We look up to the True Teachings and dare not slacken in reverence.
With awe before your majestic radiance,
We wholeheartedly prostrate and pay homage.

The transmission of virtue relies on words to enlighten those lost below. The transmission of scriptures depends on speech to guide future cultivation. In this latter age, when the Dao and virtue are in decline, should one wish to cultivate, one must rely solely on the teachings of the scriptures. The scriptures are the constant—the true path that all beings must follow. Without scriptures in the lower realms, it is like walking without a path or exiting without a door; how can one ascend or traverse? Moreover, when the Primordial Beginning first unfolded the chart, within the Dragon Han kalpa, at the beginning of the Azure Eon, in the Floating Black Realm, he revealed the scripture to deliver beings. Its characters were a zhang in size, with eight corners radiating light. He made a covenant with the Ten Heavens, transmitting salvation for ten thousand generations, storing it in the Treasure Chamber, and entrusting it to the Jade Lords. Though one may not see its form with the eyes, the blind come to see; though one may not hear its Dao with the ears, the deaf come to hear. Thus, when the scriptural teachings emerge, all in the world are delivered. If the scriptures were cut off, it would be no different from groping for a path while blind. Only those who have awakened to the true Dao may depart from words and images. Those who have not yet grasped the subtleties of the Dao must rely on the true scriptures. Through the scriptures, one attains deliverance, as if riding a great boat—unsubmerged by the waves, transcending to the shore of the Dao. In this way, beings’ ears hear, their minds are purified, their spirits are transformed, and their natures are enlightened, thereby ascending to awakening.

We respectfully follow the Eighth Precept of Cultivating the True, which states: "Do not associate with the unworthy or dwell in defiled places." Now, we disciples, in our thoughts and reflections, find reason and desire fading, habits altering our nature. We have turned away from the admonitions of harmony, kinship, filial piety, and friendship; we have transgressed the teachings of rules, standards, and norms. We have sought intimacy only with the overly familiar, and our perceptions have lacked refinement. We have gathered in frivolous company, dwelling in revelry and feasting, engaging in unprofitable laughter and talk, and subjecting one another to violence and oppression. We have not associated with upright and virtuous people but have delighted in the company of foolish women and men. Within and without, we have fabricated disputes; before and after, we have stirred up suspicions. Confused and deluded, we have been stained by dust and defiled by arrogance. For all these past karmic deeds, in our present lives, we remain benighted and unenlightened, cast aside and rejected in great number. Upon death, we fall into hell, suffering for long kalpas. When our suffering ends, we are reborn, only to enter evil destinies. When our retribution is exhausted, we return to this world, and due to our past karma, lingering misfortunes remain. We continue to suffer retribution, but now, having heard the scriptures’ teachings, we are greatly alarmed. Reverently before the sacred presence, we humbly offer our repentance. With wholehearted devotion, we take refuge and prostrate in faith.
