At times, we have abandoned our proper dwellings to dwell in tumult, or forsaken the right path and failed to follow it, placing ourselves in shameful positions and flaunting our strength with arrogance. Who would claim that rotten wood can be carved? We see only how withered roots are easily destroyed. Our sins branch out in detail, and our evil has become full to overflowing, disturbing the numinous bureaus and subjecting us to ceaseless recording and scrutiny.

Now, relying on the power of repentance, we earnestly hope for the proclamation of mercy. We beseech the Left Bureau’s Yang Officials, the Right Bureau’s Yin Officials, the Central Bureau’s Inspecting Officials, the Examining Officials, the Examining Clerks, the Examining Soldiers, the Examining Scholars, and all the great deities of the Department of Punishment and Sentencing to broadly extend their compassion and collectively grant us amnesty and absolution.

We, the repentant disciples [Names] and all those of the Dharma assembly, follow the Mysterious Statutes, enter the Dao, and ascend to the Perfected Precepts. We ought to act without desire, not cling to our own views, and vow from this day forward to associate only with those superior to ourselves, choose friends who are upright, shun dwelling in lowly places, and walk only the Middle Way. Upon hearing of goodness, we bow in reverence and dare not harbor private self-interest; upon seeing evil, we turn away and increasingly uphold the impartial rites.

Having thus made our confession, we now present this repentance. We humbly pray that blessings and fortune may come in abundance, that disasters and misfortunes may not arise, and that in all our seeing, hearing, speaking, and acting—in all our comings and goings and daily life—we may constantly serve the Most Perfect and True, forever relying on the Mysterious Teachings. Through these benefits, may all be adorned with majesty, the rain of the Teaching spread universally, the wind of benevolence extend far and wide, all people turn toward the right Dao, and the world be closed to evil schemes. May all sentient beings together ascend to the shore of the Dao.

**Pacing the Void**
At that time, the Perfected One of Wondrous Conduct addressed the assembled immortals, saying: "In the past, I heard the wondrous instructions of the Most High, who declared: 'Within the formless and nameless, the primordial chaos and boundless expanse, I opened the Dao of the Mysterious and Yellow, divided the numinous, and dispersed the qi. From the Great Luo, the Three Realms descended, and the Nine Thearchs were born as the Mysterious Ford of the Three Treasures. The Thirty-Six Departments emerged as the Mysterious Root of the Three Realms. Thereafter, the Thirty-Two Heavens and Thirty-Two Thearchs secretly communicated and transformed, branching downward into the Three Realms and traversing the twenty-eight lunar lodges and the five planets’ celestial paths to bring illumination.

The pure qi of the Five Directions ascended to form Heaven, the heavy and turbid congealed below to form Earth, and from their midst humanity was born. Heaven, Earth, and all beings—none were not complete therein. Thus, the harmonious and upright qi gave rise to the Perfected Lords and Sagely Consorts, the Jade Maidens and Immortal Ladies; the fierce and valiant qi gave rise to the Heavenly Soldiers and Divine Warriors, the divine generals and officials; the qi of yin and yang and the Five Phases gave rise to men and women. The chaotic and errant qi gave rise to flying birds and running beasts. All received the same qi, yet their myriad forms differed. According to their transformations, they received natures that varied. Emerging from the mechanism and entering the mechanism, going forth and returning, they labor endlessly under creation and transformation, relying on the molding and refining of the Dao.

I now reverently peruse the scriptural texts and deeply bear their weight. Through these words, I have been enlightened and awakened. Reflecting on the causes of the past, I have come to understand this body and arrived at the present day. Fortunate to dwell among humankind, I recognize my faults and errors. Reverently paying homage to the Heavenly Worthy, I pray for great forgiveness.'

With one heart, we respectfully pay homage, each with reverence and faith.

We reverently receive the scriptural treasure, as the Most High has bequeathed his instructions: 'On the Three Primes, the Eight Festivals, the Five La Days, the Ten Straight Days, the days of jiazi and gengshen, and one’s own life-destiny day, all the immortals and Perfected Ones—the Four Poles and Ten Flowers, the Three Realms and Four Heavens, the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens, the Diamond Divine Kings, the Good and Evil Youths, and the Sagely and Exalted Worthies—pace the void, hold banners and erect standards, burn incense and scatter flowers, grasp talismans and hold registers, and traverse the human realm, recording good and evil.

If there are sentient beings who refrain from all evil, cultivate all good, uphold fasts and observe precepts, practice the Dao and transmit scriptures, establish altars and halls, deliver gods and humans, bestow life and spread virtue, expound the Great Vehicle, teach and transform men and women, and save and deliver sentient beings, then the Heavenly Immortals will take their records of good deeds and present them to the Primordial Beginning. They will report to the Celestial Offices, which will then allow them to offset their transgressions with merit, ascend to Heaven, or attain the Dao. Some may be appointed to manage offices, sign documents, or assume various immortal ranks, advancing according to their merit. Those who ascend to the Sagely Realms do so through the accumulation of good deeds, receiving such blessed rewards.

If there are sentient beings who, as officials, cruelly oppress the myriad people, or rely on power and strength to bully the poor and lowly; who as children are unfilial or as subjects disloyal; who expose the Three Luminaries, disrespect the Three Treasures, curse Heaven and revile Earth, cheat the public for private gain, slaughter living beings, harm others or strange creatures; who commit the Ten Evils, the Five Rebellions, or offenses of the Three Karmas and Six Roots, creating evil causes and successively incurring karmic retribution—then the Heavenly Immortals will take their records of evil deeds and report them to the Primordial Beginning. All these are the retributions suffered by those who commit evil.

According to the Ninth Precept of *Cultivating the True*:
*"One must not be disloyal or unfilial, faithless or unkind."*

Now, we disciples, deeply concerned that external delusions may obscure our minds and that the benighted may never grasp the precepts of destiny and righteousness, fail to discern the proper bounds of speech and action. Gradually, we mistake a deer for a horse, usurping authority to wield power; we call a bird a phoenix, seeking favor through false display. We indulge in gambling and drink, neglecting our nurture; we covet private wealth and lust, forgetting our kin. We revile and rage at father and elder brother, slander and flatter teacher and friend, violate rites and harm instruction, delight in violence and resent poverty. Our conduct invites repeated mockery in the village, yet we fail to uphold reverence in the district. We pursue fame at the cost of truth, act contrary to our words. We move trees for gold, exchange cities for jade. We distort right and wrong, deceiving self and others; we utter empty words, unafraid of the divine. We entrap the worthy, ensnare the kind, poison all beings, and cruelly harm the multitude.

For these past deeds, in this present life, we encounter crooked paths in our affairs, suffer the scorn and neglect of others, and upon death, fall into hell, enduring long kalpas of suffering. When our suffering ends, we are reborn, only to enter evil destinies. When that retribution is exhausted, we return to this world, yet due to past karma, lingering misfortune remains, and the cycle of retribution continues unceasing.

Now, hearing the scripture’s words, we are greatly alarmed. Reverently before the sacred, we humbly offer our repentance.

chunks.original_text: 今为求忏弟子某求忏上来所犯第九品戒不忠不孝、不信不仁之罪。 先世今生，遗殃往劫，上延祖考，下逮宗亲。 事君非礼，而不克尽忠； 与人弗诚，而多行背约。 罔忽亲恩，而顽狠； 触犯长上，以欺凌。 或多言数穷，不能守中。 或用意大虐，不能慈忍。 罪将条列，恶已贯盈，挠乱灵司，纠录不已。 今凭忏力，颙望宣恩，勑下考簿检箓、执罚典刑、纠过司非、赏善纪籍、阴阳典吏，府署大神，广行慈悯，并赐赦原。 求忏弟子某同法众等遵奉玄科，入道登真戒，当行逊让，以道接物，誓从今去，结缨靖难，扇枕奉亲。 克复礼以为仁，有诸己之谓信。 四端有则，兢兢恐名教之亏；
chunks.translated_text:
This day, for the repentant disciple [Name], who seeks absolution for transgressions against the Ninth Precept—offenses of disloyalty, impiety, faithlessness, and inhumanity—we confess:

From past lives to this present existence, misfortunes from former kalpas have extended upward to ancestors and forebears, downward to clan and kin. In serving lords, we have failed in propriety and fallen short of loyalty; in dealings with others, we have lacked sincerity and broken covenants. We have neglected parental grace with obstinacy and defiance, offended superiors with insolence and oppression. At times, our words have been excessive and reckless, failing to uphold the Mean; our intentions, cruel and merciless, lacking compassion and forbearance.

Our sins are enumerated, our wickedness overflowing, disturbing the numinous bureaus and subjecting us to ceaseless recording and reproof. Now, relying on the power of repentance, we lift our gaze in hope of proclaimed mercy, beseeching the Celestial Decree to command the Registers of Karmic Examination, the Enforcers of Punitive Judgment, the Bureaus of Fault-Recording, the Scribes of Merit and Virtue, and the Officials of Yin and Yang—all the mighty deities of their offices—to extend boundless compassion and grant us pardon.

The repentant disciple [Name], together with this assembly of the Dharma, reverently adheres to the Mysterious Statutes, enters the Dao, and ascends to the Precepts of Perfection. We shall practice humility and deference, engaging with all through the Way. From this day forward, we vow to bind our caps and quell disorder, to fan pillows and serve our parents. We shall restore propriety to embody humanity, and regard fidelity as that which must first reside within ourselves. With the Four Beginnings as our guide, we shall tread cautiously, ever fearful of failing the teachings of moral cultivation.

chunks.original_text: 六典谨修，惴惴尽检防之道。 即斯发露，径此忏陈。 伏愿化日昭垂，道风丕变。 凡服膺於名节，均被冒於恩庥。 落灭恶根，殄扫邪魔之挠； 往题福籍，增延久视之龄。 常奉至真，永依玄教。 以斯利益，遍悉庄严。 道极恢宏，德绵清净。 积善臻於余庆，推诚立於良因。 获依宝祚之尊安，与天齐久； 更底璇源之深广，易地皆然。 一切有情，俱登道岸。 北极真武普慈度世法忏卷之九 北极真武普慈度世法忏卷之十 步虚 尔时，妙行真人上白天尊曰：阴阳劫运之数，可得闻乎。 天尊言曰：上天运纪，天圆十二纲，地方十二纪。 纲运三百三十度，为阳孛； 纪推三千二百度，为阴蚀。 天纲二百三十日，运关一周。 地纪二千三百日，推机一度。 九千九百度，为天地炁交，是名太阳。 九百六十度，为天地炁否，亦名大劫大运也。 以数乘之，凡三百三十年一度阳孛，故为小阳九之灾。 一百八十万九千年，即天纲运关三千三万周，地纪推机三千三百度，此大运之交也。 夫天动地静，阳躁阴迟，故有孛蚀之异耳。 此时天炁穷於太阴，地炁极於太阳。 阳极则孛，阴极则否。 阳极则其精化为水，阴极则其精化为火。 次漂之以大水，上至九天之下，下至九地之内。 金玉化消，毫末无遗。 然后九炁复合，谓之混沌再分。 则三天上圣，四天种民，下世教化亦如。 此劫之初，三皇五帝相承而治矣。 如此变革，总名为元炁离合。 太上历此离合之数，经无量劫。 故西升经云：动则有载劫，自惟甚苦勤。 又云驱除之后，开大有之民。 於是妙行稽首而言，臣等不省本源，莫知先后，切恐世人生逢劫运，何以保身。 今蒙所示，大生怖畏，是用竭心叩礼，惟道是依。 此世来生，不值灾屯，常亲妙道，愿为一身，再秉虔诚。 一心发念，敬礼真圣。 志心朝礼，虚无自然元始天尊。 志心朝礼，玉宸道君灵宝天尊。 志心朝礼，太上老君道德天尊。 志心朝礼，玉虚师相玄天上帝。 志心朝礼，圣父明真大帝。 志心朝礼，圣母琼真上仙。 志心朝礼，圣师丰乾大帝。 志心朝礼，西国紫玄元君。 志心朝礼，金阙化身天尊。 志心朝礼，玄元显应天尊。 志心朝礼，太清灵变天尊。 志心朝礼，高上玉真天尊。 志心朝礼，日光开瑞天尊。 志心朝礼，武曲应化天尊。 志心朝礼，虚星应化天尊。 志心朝礼，危星应化天尊。 志心朝礼，天一应化天尊。 志心朝礼，太一应化天尊。 志心朝礼，辰星应化天尊。 臣等志心皈身，皈神皈命，玄天显灵应化诸尊上圣。 臣恭承经宝，太上垂训曰，吾念众生，流浪沉沦，不出苦海。 此之世界，名曰弃贤宛利天境，亦曰杂报世界染欲爱天。 生在其中，暂生即灭，暂聚即散。 如彼电光，须臾即逝，不净臭秽，生老病死，痛痒疼酸，饥寒暑湿，水火刀兵，魔精鬼贼，毒风恶疰，交相中害。 念念无常，曾不暂住，苦恼几何。 目前行事，身自缠绕，尚不觉知，岂肯信有诸天道境，福地神仙，长生不死，自在无为。 世之受生，促於蜉蝣； 世之快乐，何异粪虫。 犹不自知，常为安乐，岂不是苦。 复念人之受生，未有不从先业来者，故禀神挺质，各有因缘，罪福吉凶，悉从其业。 所有寿夭、贵贱、富贫、好丑、智愚等，各不同。 乃至鸟兽、虫鱼、鸡犬、草木亦复然也。

The Six Codes are diligently observed, trembling with vigilance to uphold the Way of restraint and caution. Here and now, we openly confess and directly present this repentance. We humbly pray that the transforming sun may shine forth, and the Dao’s wind may grandly renew. May all who uphold fame and integrity be equally enveloped in grace. May evil roots be eradicated, and demonic disturbances swept away; may past merits be inscribed in the ledgers of fortune, and longevity prolonged in the vision of enduring life. May we ever serve the Most Perfect, forever abide by the Mysterious Teachings, and through this benefit, adorn all things in majesty. The Dao’s vastness is boundless, its virtue pure and unceasing. Accumulated goodness brings forth abundant blessings; sincerity establishes the foundation of good causes. May we rely upon the honored and secure throne of the precious lineage, enduring as long as Heaven; may we reach the profound and expansive depths of the celestial source, where all realms are transformed. May all sentient beings together ascend the shore of the Dao.

*Northern Culmen Perfected Warrior’s Universal Compassion Salvation Dharma Repentance*, Scroll Nine
*Northern Culmen Perfected Warrior’s Universal Compassion Salvation Dharma Repentance*, Scroll Ten

**Pacing the Void**

At that time, the Wondrously Practiced Perfected One ascended and addressed the Heavenly Worthy, saying: "May we hear of the reckoning of yin and yang’s kalpas and revolutions?"

The Heavenly Worthy replied: "The celestial reckoning follows the heavens’ twelve celestial nets and the earth’s twelve terrestrial chronicles. The net revolves through 330 degrees, forming a solar comet; the chronicle advances 3,200 degrees, forming a lunar eclipse. The celestial net completes one cycle in 230 days; the terrestrial chronicle shifts its mechanism once in 2,300 days. When 9,900 degrees are reached, the qi of Heaven and Earth converge—this is called the Great Yang. At 960 degrees, the qi of Heaven and Earth are obstructed—this is also called the Great Kalpa and Great Revolution. Multiplying these numbers, a solar comet occurs once every 330 years, thus constituting the lesser Yang’s ninefold calamity. After 1,809,000 years, the celestial net completes 330,000 cycles, and the terrestrial chronicle advances 3,300 degrees—this is the convergence of the Great Revolution. Now, Heaven moves while Earth is still; yang is restless while yin is slow—hence the anomalies of comets and eclipses. At this time, Heaven’s qi is exhausted in the Great Yin, and Earth’s qi reaches its limit in the Great Yang. When yang is at its extreme, comets appear; when yin is at its extreme, obstruction occurs. When yang is at its extreme, its essence transforms into water; when yin is at its extreme, its essence transforms into fire. Then the world is inundated by great floods, rising to the space beneath the Nine Heavens and descending into the depths of the Nine Earths. Gold and jade dissolve, leaving not even the smallest trace. Thereafter, the Nine Qi reunite—this is called the redivision of the primordial chaos. Then the sages of the Three Heavens and the seed people of the Four Heavens descend to teach and transform, as before. At the beginning of this kalpa, the Three Sovereigns and Five Emperors succeeded one another in governance. Such transformations are collectively called the separation and union of the Primordial Qi. The Most High has passed through countless kalpas of such separations and unions. Thus, the *Scripture of Western Ascension* states: 'Movement entails the burden of kalpas; I reflect on the toil of my diligence.' It also says: 'After driving away the old, I open the way for the people of the Great Existence.'"

Thereupon, the Wondrously Practiced bowed his head and said: "Your disciples, unaware of the original source, know not what came before or after. We deeply fear that those born into kalpic revolutions will have no means to preserve themselves. Now, having received this instruction, we are filled with awe and dread. Thus, we prostrate ourselves with utmost sincerity, relying solely upon the Dao. In this life and the next, may we avoid calamity and hardship, ever drawing near to the wondrous Dao. We vow to renew our devotion as one body, wholeheartedly offering reverence to the true and sacred."

With single-minded devotion, we pay homage to the True and Sacred:
We reverently bow to the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void and the Natural.
We reverently bow to the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Jade Clarity Dao Lord.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Dao and Its Virtue, the Most High Lord Lao.
We reverently bow to the Jade Void Preceptor and Minister, the Mysterious Heavenly Thearch.
We reverently bow to the Sacred Father, the Illuminated Perfected Great Emperor.
We reverently bow to the Sacred Mother, the Jade Perfected Supreme Immortal.
We reverently bow to the Sacred Preceptor, the Abundant Heavenly Great Emperor.
We reverently bow to the Purple Profundity Primordial Lady of the Western Realm.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Golden Watchtower’s Incarnation.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Mysterious Origin’s Manifest Response.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Great Clarity’s Numinous Transformation.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Lofty Jade Perfection.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Sun’s Radiant Auspiciousness.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Martial Star’s Responsive Transformation.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Void Star’s Responsive Transformation.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Danger Star’s Responsive Transformation.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Celestial One’s Responsive Transformation.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Great One’s Responsive Transformation.
We reverently bow to the Heavenly Worthy of the Chronographic Star’s Responsive Transformation.

We, your disciples, wholeheartedly take refuge in body, mind, and destiny, revering the Mysterious Heaven’s manifest and responsive transformations of all honored and sacred beings.

Your disciple reverently receives the sacred scriptures, as the Most High has taught: "I contemplate sentient beings, drifting and drowning, unable to escape the sea of suffering. This world is called the Abandoned Worthies’ Wondrous Profit Heavenly Realm, also known as the Mixed Retribution World of Defiled Desire. Those born within it perish as soon as they arise, scatter as soon as they gather. Like lightning, they vanish in an instant—impure, foul, and putrid, subject to birth, aging, sickness, and death; to pain, itching, ache, and soreness; to hunger, cold, heat, and dampness; to water, fire, blades, and weapons; to demonic spirits, ghostly thieves, poisonous winds, and malignant afflictions—all mutually inflicting harm. Each thought is impermanent, never lingering even briefly. How much suffering is there? Yet in their present actions, they remain entangled, unaware. How could they believe in the heavenly realms, blessed lands, and immortals—those who attain long life, deathlessness, and effortless freedom? The lives of those born in this world are shorter than mayflies; their joys differ not from dung-beetles. Yet they remain unaware, deeming this happiness—is this not suffering?

Furthermore, I contemplate that all who receive life do so from past karma. Thus, they are endowed with spirit and form, each with its own causes and conditions. Sin and fortune, good and ill—all arise from karma. Differences in lifespan, nobility, wealth, poverty, beauty, ugliness, wisdom, and foolishness—all vary. Even birds, beasts, insects, fish, fowl, dogs, grasses, and trees are likewise."

chunks.original_text: 况以人生，受身甚难。 逢遇一朝败坏，万劫何期。 我故殷勤戒劝汝等，所以戒劝勤修，斋戒行道，诵经礼忏，烧香然灯，布施忏悔，发愿济生度死，造像写经，度人立观，水断造桥，道边立井，渡诸行人，济诸困苦，种种方便，为其众生。 作当来径路，我岂有所求。 一切众生，各宜思惟。 谨按修真第十戒云，不得轻忽言笑、举动乖真。 以今弟子某等窃虑荡心骇目，奋臂摇身，湮没五常，忽略三畏。 譊譊不实，第多谤讪之辞； 落落无稽，谁谓毁誉之直。 谈何容易，语本空踈，拍掌长呵，纵情大笑，捧腹至为於绝倒，悦颜不惮於佞邪。 撰造虚浮，亵慢戏狎，兴居强诞，出入颠挤。 凡纲常躬履之间，惟谗谄面谀之务。 上来往业，见在世中，禀姿谬妄，措虑险巇，死堕地狱，长劫受苦，苦尽复生，遂入恶道。 报尽复还，生於兹世，以前往业，尚有余殃，受报未已。 今则闻经所说，大可惊惶。 仰对圣前恭投忏悔，志心敬礼。 志心朝礼，道元固一天尊。 志心朝礼，道炁渊冲天尊。 志心朝礼，道先大象天尊。 志心朝礼，道摅大朴天尊。 志心朝礼，道散成器天尊。 志心朝礼，道风无滞天尊。 志心朝礼，道不封治天尊。 志心朝礼，道成元梵天尊。 志心朝礼，道无可方天尊。 志心朝礼，道有可成天尊。 志心朝礼，道随炁动天尊。 志心朝礼，道迎时运天尊。 志心朝礼，道开大古天尊。 志心朝礼，道御金有天尊。 志心朝礼，道展二仪天尊。 志心朝礼，道明三友天尊。 志心朝礼，道存帝一天尊。 志心朝礼，道臻化万天尊。 志心朝礼，道上洞灵天尊。 志心朝礼，道潜入妙天尊。 志心朝礼，道性清静天尊。 志心朝礼，道观内外天尊。 志心朝礼，道能穷理天尊。 志心朝礼，道可尽性天尊。 志心朝礼，道居权世天尊。 志心朝礼，道凌常用天尊。 志心朝礼，道明博益天尊。 志心朝礼，道贵坐忘天尊。 志心朝礼，道光遗照天尊。 志心朝礼，道教圆明天尊。 志心朝礼，道文简约天尊。 志心朝礼，道理散万天尊。 志心朝礼，道情得一天尊。 志心朝礼，道运虚通天尊。 志心朝礼，道流无极天尊。 志心朝礼，道全本迹天尊。 志心朝礼，道周体用天尊。 志心朝礼，道明出入天尊。 志心朝礼，道合逍遥天尊。 志心朝礼，道常无为天尊。 天尊上圣，礼念既周。 再竭一心，遥瞻神府。 皈命紫皇天一真庆宫、元和迁校府，北极佑圣院诸仙真众。 今日道场大众，虔叩教主，北极镇天佑圣助顺真武灵应福德真君、玉虚师相玄天上帝。 伏愿施恩报德，扫秽除氛，遍际乾坤，开苏困遁。 今为弟子某忏悔上来所犯第十品戒轻忽言笑、举动乖真之罪。 先世今生，遗殃往业，上延祖考，下逮宗姻。 兴邦丧邦，谩一言之簧鼓；
chunks.translated_text:
Moreover, how rare it is for one to receive a human birth—yet in a single moment of ruin, how many kalpas must pass before another chance arises? Thus, I earnestly admonish and exhort you all: diligently cultivate, observe fasts, practice the Dao, recite scriptures, perform rites of repentance, burn incense and light lamps, give alms, confess transgressions, vow to deliver the living and ferry the dead, commission icons and copy scriptures, establish temples and halls, build bridges over streams, and dig wells by the roadside—to aid all travelers and relieve all hardships. Through these manifold expedient means, I prepare the path for future rebirths; what do I seek in return? Let all beings reflect deeply upon this.

Now, in accordance with the Tenth Precept of Cultivating the True in *Xiuzhen Jing*, which states: *"Do not treat speech and laughter lightly, nor let conduct deviate from authenticity."* Yet we disciples, in our heedlessness, allow our minds to wander and our eyes to wander, flailing our arms and swaying our bodies, drowning the Five Constants and neglecting the Three Reverences. Our words are empty and contentious, filled with slander and scorn; our demeanor is reckless and baseless, who would call it upright? How easily we speak, our words hollow and careless—clapping hands in long rebuke, indulging in uproarious laughter, clutching our bellies in uncontrollable mirth, our faces beaming without shame at flattery and deceit. We fabricate falsehoods, act with irreverence and frivolity, our movements arrogant and exaggerated, our comings and goings disorderly and unruly. In all matters of moral conduct, we concern ourselves only with flattery and sycophancy.

From past lives to the present, our accumulated karma—our inherited misfortunes and deluded dispositions—has led us to tread perilous paths. Upon death, we shall fall into hell, suffering for endless kalpas; when that torment is exhausted, we shall be reborn into evil destinies. When that retribution is complete, we may return to this world, yet the lingering consequences of past karma remain, and the cycle of suffering continues unabated. Now, having heard the scriptures’ warnings, how can we not tremble in alarm? Humbly before the sacred, we prostrate in repentance, with reverent hearts we bow in homage:

Having completed these rites of homage to the Heavenly Worthies and Perfected Ones, we now wholeheartedly gaze afar toward the divine palaces. We take refuge in the Purple Sovereign’s Heavenly One Palace of True Felicity, the Court of Primordial Harmony and Karmic Rectification, and the Northern Culmen’s Hall of Protective Sages—all the host of immortals and perfected beings therein.

Today, the assembly of this sacred altar humbly invokes the Lord of Teachings, the Northern Culmen’s Heavenly Guardian, the Protective and Auspicious True Martial Spirit of Blessed Virtue, the Jade Void’s Preceptor, the Mysterious Heavenly Emperor. May they bestow grace and repay virtue, sweep away defilement and dispel miasma, pervade heaven and earth, and awaken those lost in suffering.

Now, on behalf of disciple [Name], we repent the sins of the Tenth Precept—those of treating speech and laughter lightly and allowing conduct to deviate from authenticity. From past lives to the present, the lingering misfortunes of former karma extend upward to our ancestors and downward to our kin. Whether a nation rises or falls, a single careless word may stir the drums of chaos...

chunks.original_text: 成德败德，徒异意以锱铢。 或以言废人，或游谈聚义。 谄笑嬉戏，恣游宴以无穷； 狂狷刚强，务跳梁而罔忌。 弗恒其德，难与为仁，同而不和，骄而不泰。 罪将条列，恶已贯盈，挠乱灵司，纠录不已。 今凭忏力，颙望宣恩，勑下三官九府、百二十曹、福地洞天、名山仙境、考校考录灵司大神，巡察冥官，主纪僚属，广行慈悯，并赐赦原。 求忏弟子某遵奉玄科，入道登真戒，当行诸善，常务保持。 誓从今去，修己以敬，出入起居之益钦。 存诚不欺，举措操修之加谨。 即斯发露，径此忏陈。 伏愿覆护匪私，监观如在，施张大德，原宥积愆。 时叙调和，疾疢灾迍之殄散； 家门宁谧，水火盗贼之消除。 常奉至真，永依玄教，以斯利益，遍悉庄严，宗社绵洪，边疆澄肃。 疫疾不经於传染，瘟无致於流行。 气体充盈，时永臻於泰定； 精神发越，寿可算於耆颐。 一切有情，俱登道岸。 北极真武普慈度世法忏卷之十
chunks.translated_text:
Where virtue is cultivated or corrupted, mere hairsbreadths of intent diverge. Some by speech ruin others, while others in idle discourse gather righteousness. Flattering laughter and frivolous play indulge in endless revelry; reckless obstinacy and stubborn pride leap and bound without restraint. Failing to steadfastly uphold virtue, one cannot be called humane—aligned yet discordant, arrogant yet unyielding.

The sins now stand enumerated, evil brimming to its full measure, disturbing the numinous bureaus, ceaselessly recorded and bound. Today, we rely upon the power of repentance, gazing upward in hope of proclaimed grace, beseeching the Three Officials and Nine Courts, the Hundred-Twenty Ministries, the blessed lands and grotto-heavens, the sacred mountains and immortal realms, the great deities of the Auditing and Recording Offices, the patrolling underworld officials, the registrars and their subordinates—to widely extend compassion and together grant absolution.

The repentant disciple [Name], upholding the Mysterious Statutes, entering the Dao and ascending to Perfection through the Precepts, shall practice all goodness and constantly strive to preserve them. From this day forward, I vow to cultivate reverence within, that all movements and repose may be ever more solemn. To maintain sincerity without deceit, that all conduct and self-discipline may be ever more vigilant. Here and now, I openly confess and present this repentance.

We humbly pray for impartial protection, that your watchful gaze may ever be present, bestowing great virtue and pardoning accumulated transgressions. May the seasons be harmonious and orderly, banishing illness, calamity, and misfortune; may the household be tranquil, dispelling water, fire, theft, and banditry. May we ever serve the Supreme Perfection, forever abide in the Mysterious Teachings, and through these blessings adorn all things. May the ancestral line flourish and endure, the frontiers be serene and orderly. May epidemics not spread through contagion, pestilence not arise in circulation. May qi and body be abundant, the times ever attain peace and stability; may spirit flourish and vitality soar, that longevity reach venerable years. May all sentient beings together ascend the shore of the Dao.
